texts.es: Marta se dedica a la venta de queso, carnes frías, postres y cosméticos,  mediante una guía especializada de una empresa, a la que está afiliada, pues es esta la que le ofrece el catalogo y los productos para que desarrolle su labor promocional y de ventas. Con su anterior credikiva, ella logró comprar estos productos en mayor volumen y está muy satisfecha, porque ganó descuentos que sus proveedores le hicieron y porque agregó un nuevo producto: el postre, el cual le ha dado muy buen resultado, porque  lo  elabora  y distribuye desde los lunes y cobra su cartera los sábados. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “ Les doy gracias por prestarme el dinero para salir adelante y espero que sigan apoyándome y yo responderé bien al crédito”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará materiales como leche condensada, chocolate, galletas, para elaborar postres y comprar queso, pues son  los productos que mas se venden a final de año, debido a las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año y ella estará siempre dispuesta,  a servir a sus clientes y aprovechando la oportunidad que le ofrece el mercado para ganar aun mas dinero.
texts.en:
Marta works selling cheese, cold meats, desserts, and cosmetics, though the catalogue of a business with which she is affiliated. This business offers her the catalogue and the products so that she can carry out her work promoting and selling. With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to buy a greater volume of these products and she is very satisfied, because she got discounts from the providers and she added a new product: desserts, from which she has gotten really good results, because she makes it and distributes it starting Monday and collects the money on Saturdays. 

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for lending me the money to move forward and I hope that you continue to support me and I will respond well to the loan." She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan, with which she will buy ingredients like condensed milk, chocolate, and cookies, to make desserts and buy cheese. These are the products that sell most at the end of the year, because of the Christmas and end-of-year festivities. She is always ready to serve her customers and take advantage of the opportunity that the market gives her to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as condensed milk, chocolate, and cheese to make pastries

loans.name: Blanca Hortencia

texts.es:
Blanca Hortensia  tiene 22 años es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Blanca Hortensia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra y vende los productos en Mocache.

Solicita el crèdito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es comprar un terreno y cultivar en el.

Disfruta escuchando mùsica.
texts.en:
Blanca Hortensia is 22 years old, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

The PROGRESO (Progress) office is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, belonging to the canton Mocache. This office is dedicated to short cycle agriculture like corn and rice.

Blanca Hortensia is dedicated to agriculture through the sowing of corn and rice. She buys and sells products in Mocache.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and insecticides for cultivation. The loan will help her to increase her revenue for the well-being of her family. Her dream is to buy her own land and work it.

She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Amanda es indudablemente una persona de un corazón humilde, Amanda, dice que es una persona, honrada, luchadora y muy trabajadora que ama a su esposo, ya que juntos trabajan en la agricultura, tiene una hija de 7 años a quien ama, a ella le encanta la agricultura y lo importante para ella es sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo empleara en la compra de semilla de frejol y en la compra de fungicidas e insecticidas para el cuidado de las plantas de papa, ya que en estas fechas proliferan insectos que dañan las plantas, y las tienen que cuidar para no perder la cosecha en esta temporada. 

El sueño que la Sra. Amanda tiene es comprarse un tractor y así poder triplicar la producción que tiene en estos momentos, esta consiente que cumplir su sueño es posible pero tiene que trabajar, y es por ello que todos los días se levanta agradeciendo a dios un día más de vida donde pueda trabajar para poder cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Amanda is undoubtedly a person with a humble heart. She says she is honest, a fighter, hardworking, and loves her husband. They work together in agriculture and have a 7 year old daughter that loves agriculture. The most important things for her is for her family to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan from Fodemi to buy bean seeds, fungicides and insecticides for the care of the potato plants. These days the insects are proliferating and damaging the plants and they have to be careful not to lose the harvest this season.

Amanda's dream is to buy a tractor to be able to triple their current production. She knows the dream is possible, but she will have to work. That is why every day she gets up thanking God for one more day of life where you can work to fulfill your dream.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fungicides and insecticides for the care and protection of the potato crop.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza  46 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 15, 18, y 24 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de fritos y tortillas. Ella inicio trabajando con  su  mama en la producción de tortilla, luego ella se caso y decidió independizarse, poner su propio negocio de vender fritangas, con pequeños préstamo que le hicieron, ya que ella anteriormente dependía solo de los ingresos que le daba su esposo, pero no le ajustaba para el sustento del hogar.
Maritza solicita el financiamiento para comprar leña y  maíz procesado al  por mayor, etc. Toda la materia prima que necesita para  la elaboración de sus tortillas. Para aprovechar la temporada de ventas ya que tendrá un buen ingreso de lo vendido, tiene como planes en el futuro ampliar y diversificar su negocio en su casa, de esta manera poder incrementar sus ganancias para darle una buena presentación al local donde actualmente vende.
texts.en:
Maritza is 46 years old, she is originally from Granada. She is married and a mother to 3 children who are 15, 18 and 24 years old. Maritza is a salesperson, she sells fried food and tortillas, she began her trade with her mother by making tortillas and later on she got married she went on her own to set up her business selling fried fast food with a small loan. Before she used to depend on the income that her husband gave her but it was not enough to meet the household expenses.

Maritza needs a loan to buy firewood and wholesale processed corn, etc. All the raw materials are needed to make the tortillas. She wants to take advantage of the selling season since she will have a good income from what she sells. Maritza plans to expand and diversify her household business and to increase her income to give her place a good presentation to her customers.

loans.use: buy firewood and wholesale processed corn, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Glenda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials. 

Glenda is borrowing 25000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, sugar, and other groceries for her store.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, sugar, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is 47 years old. She lives with her husband in the small village of Kvareli district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf. Manana milks the cows and produces cheese, which is sold in an open market at a good price. Her husband has a horse, and goes to the forest and brings wood by horse to sell locally. In addition, they have a vineyard and 1.6 hectares of land, where maize is grown. Manana sells harvested maize and vines locally. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. Manana requested a loan for renovation of their house. After the house is renovated, they will be able to spend winters in better conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nancy works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Nancy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new autorickshaw body for her husband's rickshaw transport business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 43 years old and married with 10 children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines and other groceries.

In the future Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in rice farming for several years now. This is the source of their income. Flordeliza is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With these, they will be able to improve their farm, thus increasing their harvest and yield.

In the future, Flordeliza dreams of making her farming business a success. She also wants to save money to reinvest in the business and for future use.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 39 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Julie has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Julie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is involved in agriculture.  She breeds cattle and grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables.  Currently her farm includes 2 pigs, 10 chickens and 12 little pigs.  She cultivates wheat and tomatoes, as well as growing peach and pear trees with great love and care.  She has applied for this loan to expand her farm with special milk cows.  With the requested amount she will purchase 3 cows.  This will enable her to get milk and use it in cheese production.  

Anush lives with her husband and three children.  She is a very hardworking lady and together with her husband, they do their best to give their children a good and secured life.  The loan is very important for Anush to get high income and ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Ma. Cecil

texts.en:
Ma. Cecil is 44 years old and married with two children. 

Ma. Cecil is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  Ma. Cecil requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Ma. Cecil has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Cecil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Un mayor volumen de verduras compró Ramón a un buen precio y las vendió rapidamente y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. El dice a sus financiadores lo siguiente: "Gracias por el apoyo dado, ha sido de mucho beneficio para mi y mi negocio. hay un voto de confianza." En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevp credikiva, con el cual comprará verduras, frutas, como zanahoria, cebolla, tomate, lechuga entre otras verduras y pomelos, borojó, uvas y durazno, para venderle a otros negocios que preparan comidaas con estos productos como insumos y aumentar sus ventas. El se siente muy felíz con Kiva y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque además logró tener vida crediticia y está construyendo su reputación financiera.
En la
texts.en:
Thanks to his Kiva loan, Ramón bought a large quantity of vegetables at a good price and sold them quickly.  He has the following to say to his lenders: "Thanks for your help.  It has been very beneficial for me and my business.  It's a vote of confidence."

Currently he's applying for another loan to buy carrots, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and other vegetables, and grapefruit, borojó fruit, grapes, peaches, and other fruits.  He's going to sell to other businesses that prepare food with these products so he can increase his sales.

He's very happy with Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because he also managed to have a financial life and he's building his business reputation.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 28 años, está casada con Rudy. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jack, de 10 y Anahi, de 4 años. Margarita y su familia viven en la casa de su madre, ubicada en un distrito de la selva central. Margarita es una mujer muy laboriosa, se dedica a varias cosas. Desde la elaboración de cajones de maderas, o como jornalera. En todo este tiempo pudo juntar un capital de dinero necesario para poder abrir un  pequeño puesto de comida rápida donde vende anticuchos, hamburguesas y salchichas y papas fritas. Los que en todo este tiempo, tiene gran acogida. “Las personas ya me conocen por eso siempre vienen a comer, además en estas comidas no hay pierde”, comenta. 
Estos días no hay cosechas, ni mucho trabajo agrícola, por eso se enfoca en la preparación de sus alimentos. Tiene planeado aumentar sus ventas, por eso también quiere extender su espacio y colocar estantes y ofrecer más productos, tales como abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, por eso requiere de su ayuda. Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP. Por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. A la vez menciona sentirse contenta trabajando dentro de su banco comunal “Luz del futuro”, por la solidaridad y confianza de sus socios.
Con los 3000 soles podrá adquirir más carne e insumos para la preparación de alimentos, así también piensa comprar abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para extender su negocio en una pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Margarita is 28 years old and is married to Rudy. Together they have 2 children: Jack, 10 and Anahi, 4. Margarita and her family live in her mother's home located in the central district of the jungle. Margarita is very hardworking and is dedicated to several things including making wooden crates, or as a day laborer.

In all this time, she gathered the money needed to open a small fast food stand where she sells kebabs, burgers, sausages, and french fries. It was received very well. She says, "People already know me, that is why they come to eat. Also on these foods there is no loss."

These days there are no crops, and not much agricultural work. Therefore, she is focused on food preparation. She plans to increase her sales and wants to extend her space and put up shelves and offer more products, such as groceries and staples. For this, she requires your help.

This is her 12th loan with MFP. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with the payments. At the same time she mentioned she feels happy working with the “Luz del futuro” (Light of the Future) group, due to the solidarity and confidence of its partners.

With the 3000 soles ($1175) she will acquire more meat and ingredients for the food preparation and also plans to buy groceries and staples to extend her business in a small store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and staples.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata, de 31 años, está casada con Nilo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Noralei, de 16 y Jair de 10 años. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural de la selva central. Desde aproximadamente 10 años, Fortunata se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son café y cítricos.  Con los ahorros obtenidos logró abrir otro negocio en su hogar. “Esta actividad es más relajada y también es rentable, especialmente en la venta de bebidas”, menciona. En su casa se ubica el único teléfono de la zona, “estoy contenta con mis logros por que todo lo obtuve con sudor y esfuerzo”, explica. 
Desde hace 5 años  labora así. Ahora desea esforzarse más, pues su hija se encuentra estudiando una carrera universitaria. La  temporada navideña será provechosa, según sus cálculos, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir mayor mercadería.  Éste es su préstamo número 13 con MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Le agrada el trabajo con su banco comunal “Luz del futuro”, por encontrarse en un ambiente familiar y amical. Invertirá los 500 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, así como más gaseosas y cervezas, los que venderá en su tienda instalada en su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 31, is married to Nilo; they have two children, Noralei, 16 and Jair, 10.  This family lives in their own house located in a rural district in the central jungle.  For about 10 years Fortunata has been working in agriculture growing mainly coffee and citrus fruit.  With savings earned from this she opened another business at home.  “This activity is more relaxed and is also profitable, especially the sale of beverages,” she mentions.  Her house has the only telephone in the zone.  “I’m happy with my accomplishments because I accomplished all of them through my own sweat and effort,” she explains.

She’s been working like this for five years.  Now, she wants to put even more effort into it because her daughter has started university.  The Christmas season is very profitable according to her calculations so she needs help to acquire more merchandise.  This will be her 11th MFP loan so she commits to make her payments punctually.  She enjoys the work in her “Luz del Futuro” (Light of the Future) communal bank because of its friendly family atmosphere.  She will use the 500 soles to buy basic staples as well as soft-drinks and beer to sell in her home-based grocery store.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and beer.

loans.name: Alejandra De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Alejandra, de 32 años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de 1 hijos de 7 años de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante. Se dedica a trabajar en su pulpería. Esta actividad la empezó con ayuda de su mama, quien   la  motivo a tener su propio negocio, ya que su esposo es asalariado y con lo que gana no le ayuda mucho en los gastos familiares, fue allí que  decidió   invertir en el otro negocio como es  la venta de comida,  que  les vende a sus amigos del centro de salud. Actualmente tiene 7 años de estar funcionando y ha resultado rentable, ya que no hay días  en que no se vende, siempre tiene clientes.
Ella requiere el crédito para comprar  granos básicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc. Su propósito es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea  bien surtida, su meta próxima es ampliar su venta de comida para ofrecerles a sus clientes platillos de toda variedad.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 32, is from Granada; she’s married to a merchant and is the mother of a 7-year-old child.  She works in her grocery store.  She started this activity with help from her mother who encouraged her to have her own business because her husband is a salaried employee and she helps him cover household expenses with what she earns.  This was when she decided to invest in another business: selling food to her friends in the health center.  She’s been in business for 7 years now and is having profitable results since there are no days when she does not sell; she always has customers.

She needs the loan to buy basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, etc.  Her goal is to turn her grocery store into a well-stocked variety store and her next goal is to expand the food sales to offer all variety of dishes to her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This is Michelle, 33, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she lives with her parents and helps them manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Michelle sells ice scramble. In a tropical country like the Philippines, Filipinos thought of different foods to beat the heat. Ice scramble is just one of those foods. She is also into a direct-selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ice, different candies, and chocolates needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Michelle dreams to have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients for ice scramble such as ice, different candies, and chocolate needed in her business.

loans.name: Rama Swami Group

texts.en:
Rama Swami is the name of this Joint Liability Group. All six active women entrepreneurs of this group belong to Bhawanipatna town in Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Pindar, sitting back in the group photo with a blue dress, is one of them.  She is 47 years of age and lives with her eight-member family comprised of her husband, two sons, two daughters-in-law and two grandchildren.
 
Pindar is running a refrigerator repair and air conditioner fitting workshop in her house and an auto repair garage in town with the help of her two sons. The refrigerator repair workshop has been running for the last seven years. People from the town and the periphery depend on her workshop. Her son also keeps orders for fitting air conditioners in the vehicles. He covers a distance of 100 kms radius for this work. She has engaged three skilled workers in her workshop @ 3,000 INR each per month.  Her monthly net income from these businesses is around 10,000 INR. But in the opinion of Pindar, it is insufficient to manage the workshop as well as the household expenses. Pindar depends on the nearest wholesale market 300 kms. away for purchasing materials like gas and other spare parts. With the loan, she has a plan to purchase gas and spare parts for refrigerator repairs. With this, she will add some extra income to her family to lead a better life. Pindar has a dream of constructing a house for her family as the present one is not comfortable for such a big family.
    
The other five members of the group are Umapriya, Sabita, Hem, Sorojinidei and Anusaya who run a cycle mart, a fancy store, a cycle store, a Tiffin hotel and a cloth business, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, gas and spare parts

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda,  She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in better profits.  Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Criselda hopes her children will finish their studies.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika is 18 years old, married and lives with her husband and an infant daughter. Several times, she has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Marika’s husband, who works as a waiter. 

Marika requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Marika will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and resell them in her district for a profit. It will be hard work for Marika, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. Her family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 52 years old.  She has five children who are between the ages of 16 and 10 years old.  She is married to a house builder. 

She sells food stuff.  She is been in this type business 15 years.  She wants to use her loan to buy more food stuff.  Out of her profit she wants to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 26 years old.  He is single.  He wants a loan to increase his food stuff such as rice, beans, and tomatoes.  He has been in business for one year.  With his profit he wants to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is 30 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 & 1.  He is an installer of antennas and air conditioning.  

But the main scope of his income for the family is gardening and field crops.  He has been involved in this activity for seven years.  He plants tomatoes, aubergine, dates, quince and other fruits & vegetables.  His plans for future is to expand the gardening and to start a livestock business. 
The loan Rashad has applied for will be used for the growing of tomatoes.  From the income he wants to complete the house construction.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for tomatoes growing.

loans.name: Anglique

texts.en: Angelique is 33 years old. She is married and has four children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is 8. Her husband is a civil servant. With the loan, she will buy more shoes for sale. She’s been in business for three years. She wants to use her profit for savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is from the town of Tiribe. She's a merchant and the owner of a food kiosk. She has been doing this work for two years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

She is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning to prepare the food she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy seats to make her customers comfortable and wheat flour to increase the amount of food she’s preparing. This is what she most needs and uses every day.

She's grateful for this opportunity because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and seats for her food kiosk

loans.name: Minavere

texts.en: Minavere, is a widow and mother of two children ages six and seven years old. She has been running her own furniture upholstery business for the last two years. She had started with very low demand and clients but now is very satisfied with the level of business she has achieved and number of clients she serves. As people in Kosovo usually change the color and patterns of their furniture instead of buying new ones due to economical situations, her business is very successful. She has a lot of customers throughout Kosovo and is a very professional and hardworking woman who puts a lot of effort into her business in order to satisfy her customers. Minavere requests a loan to buy materials for her work.She hopes that the loan will help her to continue her business and help it grow even more. Her hope is that in the future she will be able to give her children a better education and life. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy upholstery materials for her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee es una mujer incansable. Tiene 46 años de edad y está felizmente casada con Pablo, con quién tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos. Ellos habitan un hogar propio ubicado en un anexo rural de la selva central. Aidee es una mujer ejemplar.  Gracias a su habilidad ha podido mantener y educar a sus 4 hijos. Actualmente cuenta con una tienda de comestibles en la que vende gaseosas, golosinas y productos de primera necesidad. En el mismo puesto expende carne de pollo, que es su negocio más rentable. “Además de la carne de pollo, se vende más las bebidas gaseosas y las cervezas heladas”, menciona.
Cada semana viaja hasta la ciudad más cercana (a 1 hora y media), para adquirir la carne de pollo y las bebidas.
Más adelante, le gustaría instalar una bodega más amplia, donde ofrecería todo tipo de productos y confía, que con esfuerzo y constancia lo puede conseguir. Por ahora continúa laborando en el campo, apoyando a algunos agricultores en la limpieza de sus cultivos. Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por esa razón será responsable en el pago de las cuotas, como lo ha hecho en los ciclos anteriores. Con respecto a “Luz del Futuro”, su banco comunal, menciona sentirse muy a gusto y satisfecha con el trabajo en equipo.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir más carne de pollo, bebidas gasificadas, cerveza y otros para expenderlos en su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Aidee is an indefatigable woman. She is 46 years old and happily married to Pablo, with whom she has four children, although only two of them still live at home. They live in their own home located in a small rural community in the central rainforest. 

Aidee is an exemplary woman. Thanks to her abilities, she has been able to provide for and educate her four children. Currently, she has a food shop where she sells soft drinks, snacks, and basic necessities. She also sells chicken meat, which is her most profitable product. "Besides chicken meat, soft drinks and cold beer sell best," she explains. Every week, she travels to the nearest city (one and a half hours away) to purchase chicken meat and drinks. 

In the future, she would like to set up a larger shop where she would offer all kinds of products. She trusts that with hard work and persistence, she can achieve that. For now, she continues to work in the fields, helping some farmers weed their crops. 

This is Aidee's eighth loan with MFP, so she will be responsible in making her loan payments as she has been in previous cycles. With respect to her communal bank, "Luz del Futuro" ["Light of the Future"], she says that she feels very pleased and satisfied with their teamwork.

With the money, she will be able to purchase more chicken meat, soft drinks, beer, and other products to offer in her shop.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat, carbonated drinks, and beer.

loans.name: Geovanny

texts.es:
Don Geovanny es una persona de emprendimiento, siempre alegre, y carismático lleno de virtudes que le han hecho ganarse el aprecio de sus vecinos, Don Geovanny se define como una persona tranquila, honesta y  muy trabajadora, Geovanny es casado y tiene 3 hijos a quienes ama con toda su vida y lucha día a día por verles felices.

El crédito que don Geovanny solicito a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de puertas metálicas ya que se dedica a la mecánica industrial, además se invertirá en la compra de una soldadora y de una cortadora necesarios para la perfecta fabricación de sus puertas.


El sueño que Geovanny tiene es seguir trabajando y tener un local más amplio donde hacer su trabajo y de esta manera poder solventar la educación de sus hijos,  como también solventar las necesidades básicas  de su hogar, y  buscar el bienestar para  su familia.
texts.en:
Geovanny is an enterprising person who is always happy, charismatic, and full of ideals that have gotten for him the admiration of his neighbors.  Geovanny is known as a peaceful, honest, and very hardworking person.  He's married and has three children, whom he loves with his whole life and for whose happiness he strives every day.

The loan Geovanny requested from FODEMI is to invest in buying raw materials to make metal doors, because he makes a living as an industrial mechanic.  He also will invest in buying a soldering iron and a cutting machine, which are necessary for making his doors perfectly.

Geovanny's dream is to continue working and have a bigger space to do his work.  This way he would be able to pay for his children's education expenses.  He also wants to pay for his household's basic necessities and find well-being for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make metal doors

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene la edad de 45 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que María se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old, married, and has three children.

She wants the loan to buy cattle to raise, which she will sell for a profit when they are large. The livestock business will help her and her family get ahead.
This is the first time María has financed with FUDECOSUR. She says the credit committee has helped her very much and provided many facilities.

She hopes that this project can grow and achieve her goals so she can provide a better quality of life for her family in the future as well as improved economic stability.

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans from local banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan much more easily and with lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán  de 40 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 16 años, en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, a orillas del mar caribe, donde sus playas, la brisa y el mar,  hacen de él,  el deleite de sus habitantes y de turistas,  que se acercan para recrearse y estar mas  cerca a la naturaleza. Hernán es propietario de una tienda que ha convertido también en un restaurante, donde además de ranchos, víveres, licores, refrescos, vende comidas marinas y corrientes de acuerdo a los deseos de sus clientes. Su idea emprendedora nació después de no encontrar un empleo y buscaba la forma de generar ingresos para lograr el sostenimiento de su familia. Hoy su tienda provee a las amas de casa, lo que las familias consumen diariamente y también vende especialmente los fines de semanas, comidas, para los transeúntes y turistas que por allí pasan, Sus ventas las realiza de contado y también a crédito a clientes, de los cuales conoce su comportamiento de pagos. Su meta mas adelante es convertirlo en un autoservicio y terminar una segunda planta, para trasladarse con su familia y separar el espacio familiar del productivo, que hace mucha falta para conseguir el sosiego familiar. Como poco a poco intenta conseguir sus sueños, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, refrescos, en mayor volumen para lograr descuentos especiales y tener inventario con el cual responder a sus clientes en las fiestas de fin de año que se acercan y es una oportunidad tener todo lo que la clientela necesita para poder vender mucho mas.
texts.en:
Hernán, 40, lives with his wife and two children who are 12 and 16 years old in Puerto Colombia on the shores of the Caribbean Sea where its beaches, breezes and sea make it delightful for its residents and tourists who visit to be nearer to nature.

Hernán owns a store that’s also become a restaurant where in addition to packaged snacks, food items, liquor and soft-drinks he also sells seafood and daily specials according to his customers’ wishes.  His entrepreneurial idea arose when he was unable to secure employment and was looking for a way to generate income to support his family.  Today, his store provides housewives with what families consume daily and on weekends especially he sells prepared food to passersby and tourists who pass by there.  He sells for cash and also on credit to customers who he knows are responsible with their payments.  His goal for later on is to turn it into a self-service store and to build a second story to move his family into thus separating the living quarters from the business area which is very necessary in order to provide serenity for his family.

Since he plans to attain his dreams little by little, he’s applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy food items, snacks and soft-drinks in larger amounts to qualify for special discounts and have stock on-hand to meet customer demand for end-of-year festivities that are approaching; this is an opportunity to have everything his clientele needs so he can sell much more.

loans.use: to buy food items, packaged snacks and soft-drinks in larger amounts.

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es: Kelly de 26 años de edad, es una joven dedicada al comercio de calzado, ropa y prendas de oro. Ella distribuye sus productos, después de haber hecho su preventa y recuperación de cartera de créditos. Desde hace 1 año cuando inició, sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes especializados en la ciudad de Bucaramanga,  donde la  calidad de estos productos es inigualable. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y empleados que estos le refieren.  Kelly tiene como meta principal,  hacer crecer su negocio pues sueña con adquirir un local propio y su mayor desafío,  es no tener fuentes de financiamientos que la ayuden a apalancar sus cuentas por cobrar. Esto es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, prime financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado, blusas, jeanes y prendas de vestir, pues aprovechará la época navideña y de despedida del año nuevo, temporada donde las familias se visten elegantes, para celebrarlas y recibir el año que inicia. Este es justamente el éxito de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que le ayudará a tener un capital de trabajo adicional,  para comprar en mayor volumen y es recibido en la mejor época del año para comercializar: el mes de Diciembre.
texts.en:
Kelly, 26, is a young woman who sells footwear, clothing and gold jewelry.  She does her pre-sales and then distributes her goods and collects payment from her credit customers.  Since she started a year ago she pays cash for her purchases in specialized stores in the city of Bucaramanga where quality of said products in unequalled.  Her main customers are her neighbors and employees they refer to her.  Kelly’s main goal is to make her business grow because she dreams with acquiring her own locale and her greatest challenge in not having a source of financing to help her while her accounts receivable are collected.  

Because of this, she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy footwear, blouses, jeans and items of clothing to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year’s season when families dress up elegantly to celebrate and welcome the year that’s beginning.  This is why her Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, will be successful because it will help her have additional working capital to buy in larger amounts and it comes at the best time of the year for sales: the month of December.

loans.use: to buy footwear, blouses, jeans and articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling drinking water in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more drinking water to sell to her customers.

NWTF is re-listing Jennifer's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig, 36 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a laundry service for one year and generally vendors use his service, especially butchers. Also he does carpentry work by order. His wife teaches sewing at a manufacturing and crafting college. He is requesting a loan of 4.000.000 MNT to purchase an environmentally friendly car that runs on natural gas. By doing so, the family won’t spend money on taxis; also he can spare more time for his family, and most importantly, a car that runs on natural gas emits less smoke, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase an environmentally friendly car which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 22 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is four years old and the youngest is one years old. She’s been in business for five years. She will use the loan to buy more shirts and sweaters. With the profit, she will buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and sweaters to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single young man. He operates a barber shop, which is distinguished by its location (where there is a lot of traffic). He has many loyal customers and a good reputation among them.

Ahmad's project has been a profitable one, and it is the only source of income for him, but from time to time, he needs more support to cover the cost of making improvements.

Ahmad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting his shop and buying new decorations, such as shelves and ceiling fixtures.

This will make his barbershop attractive and give a new image to his shop, which will attract new customers and satisfy the loyal ones. This will lead to improving Ahmad's income positively and ensuring a bright future for him.

Ahmad is photographed inside his barbershop while he is working.

loans.use: To paint his salon and buy new decorations

loans.name: Levan

texts.en: Levan is from the Vani district. He is 31 years old, single and lives with his mother who has chronic health problems and is provided with a relevant pension from the local government. Levan’s source of income is a small amount of rent from his store.  As the existing income is not enough for the family, Levan decided to start a new business. In particular, he plans to finish the renovation of an additional store and rent it for a good price. Levan has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. However, his loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, for they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this loan, Levan will install doors and windows in his newly built store and renovate it properly so that it satisfies the personal needs of his clients. Levan hopes his business will be profitable and this will increase his income, providing his family with enough money to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to install doors and windows in his store

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is 28 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a coastal province of Kenya. 

Mwanasha has been providing tailoring services for the last two years, mainly tailoring traditional clothing on-demand. She is now requesting a Ksh 20,000 loan to purchase a large amount of fabric to tailor traditional clothes for the New Year, which is a high-demand season for traditional clothing.

She is a hardworking and highly experienced tailor.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 48 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Fe has a food production business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Al-Lulah Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Lulah. It is made up of seven women from Taiz, Yemen. They are hard-working women. They took a loan of 140,000 YER. Ramzia is a 23-year-old woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She has been operating a small general store. Due to her professional experience in this field, she attracted more clients, which helped her business to continue running successfully and made the business more profitable. In the pursuit of satisfying her clients, she has just obtained her second a youth loan of 20,000 YER from AMB. This new loan is meant to allow her to supply her business with food items to enable her to better respond to the demands of her clients and make higher profits. In the future, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to supply food items for her business

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is 32 years old. She is a widow with two children, the oldest is 13 and the youngest is 7. She sells vegetables and she wants a loan to buy more tomatoes, carrots, green beans and cabbages. She’s been in business for 12 years. With the profit, she wants to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, carrots, green beans and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 50 years old and married, with three children. Merlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines, and other groceries.

Merlina has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Blanca Teresa

texts.es:
Blanca Teresa  tiene 43 años es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao hace 10 años.

Blanca Teresa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz en terrenos propios. Compra y vende sus productos en Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa con un jardìn y galpon.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo labores de la casa.
texts.en:
Blanca Teresa is 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the rural community of Aguas Frías de Mocache in the canton of Mocache. 

The "El Progreso" communal bank is also located in Aguas Frías de Mocache, in the canton of Mocache. For the past ten years, members of this communal bank have made their livings farming short-cycle crops, like corn, rice, and cacao.

Blanca Teresa works in agriculture, growing corn and rice on her own fields. She buys her supplies and sells her harvests in Mocache.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, urea, insecticides, fertilizers, and compost for her crops. The previous loan helped her to increase her income to support her family and to invest in her crops. 

Blanca Teresa's dream is to buy a house with a yard and a shed. In her free time, she really enjoys doing housework.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides, fertilizers and compost for her crops.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 45 años de edad, vive con Fernando, su pareja, con quien tiene 6 hijos, la mayoría de ellos ya tiene su propia familia. Por eso ella y su pareja viven con la menor de 8 años en una casa propia en una localidad de la selva central. Rosa trabaja con ahínco en los terrenos agrícolas que posee. Ella es una agricultora responsable. Es así que, en las 5 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivos tiene sembrados 30 quintales de granos de café, árboles de naranjas, limones y paltas.
Esta actividad le permitió conseguir el capital necesario para adquirir una camioneta, la que maneja uno de sus hijos mayores. Con la movilidad realiza el servicio de flete y traslada las cosechas de sus vecinos hacia la ciudad, que mayormente son frutas en cajones de madera. “Por cada viaje estamos cobrando como 80 soles, eso varía de acuerdo a la cantidad de la carga”, menciona. Cada cosecha reúne sus productos en cajones y los ofrece a sus compradores. Le va bien.
Es así como trabaja coordinadamente con su hijo, cuyos ingresos benefician a ambos. 
Entre los anhelos de Rosa, está el ver a su hija de 8 años realizarse profesionalmente y educarse con estudios superiores, por esa razón seguirá trabajando hasta conseguir sus metas. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP. Pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del futuro” y se siente a gusto trabajando con socios activos y solidarios. Dice que pagará puntualmente las cuotas mensuales. 
Con los 500 soles solicitados podrá adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café, y cajones para trasladar la cosecha de plátanos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, she lives with Fernando, her partner with whom she has 6 children; most of them already have their own family. That is why she and her partner live with the youngest child who is 8 years old in their own home located in the central jungle. Rosa works with endless energy on her agricultural farmland, she is a responsible farmer. In the 5 hectares of agricultural land, she has 30 quintals (100 kgs) of coffee, orange, lemon and avocado trees.

Her work has allowed her to have enough to get a truck that is driven by one of her oldest children. With the transportation she also provides freight services and transports mostly fruits crops of her neighbors to the city that are stored in wooden crates. “For each trip we are charging about 80 soles, this changes according to the quantity of the shipment,” she says. Each harvest she gathers her products in crates and offers them to her buyers. She does well.

That is how she works in coordination with her son, the income is beneficial to both.

Among Rosa’s wishes is that she would like to see her 8 year old daughter be a professional and earn a university education, that is why she will keep working until she metes her goals. This is her third loan with MFP. She belongs to the “Light of the Future” communal bank and is happy to be working with active and supportive people. Rosa says that she will pay her payment quotas on time.

With the 500 soles she will buy organic manure bags for her coffee crops and crates to translate the plantain harvest.

loans.use: buy organic manure bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 27 years old, lives with his mother in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They reside in their own ger (Mongolian traditional home) on a plot of land. Jargalsaikhan has been working as a cook for five years, and his mother is retired from work. He learned all his cooking skills in Korea. He is a very hard-working individual who strives to improve his living standard for the sake of his mother. In order to generate more income, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. Using this car, he can render taxi service to local residents during his free time. This loan is very beneficial for both him and the environment as the car can be used for taxi service while emitting less smoke and thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising ducks and chickens in the Philippines. She earns additional income from clothing sales. Josephine is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her ducks and chickens.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is a young farmer from Verishen village. He is 25 years old and is involved in agriculture. He keeps livestock which currently includes two cows and two pigs. Harutyun also has a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates tomatoes and beans. 

Harutyun lives with his mother and sister and is the only bread winner for the family. He has applied for this loan to expand his farm. With the requested amount Harutyun will purchase 16 pigs and three calves. He plans to grow and fatten them and resell them for a higher price. This will enable him to earn a high income and cover the family's daily expenses.

This loan is very important for Harutyun to earn a high income and be able to ensure better living conditions for his mother and sister.

loans.use: to pay for 16 pigs and three calves.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of 12 children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than three years now.

Florencia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Yeabu.  She is married and has four children ages 25, 20, 15 and 6.  Three of them are in school. In 1987, Yeabu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she was not fortunate to go to school.  She went into business from her mother who was a trader then.  After she got married, she started her own business.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 646,000 every month from this business. 

Yeabu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil (2 1/2 drums @ Le1,200,000). In the future, Yeabu plans to educate her school-going children and improve her business. The rise and fall of prices of goods is her major challenge.  Yeabu is hard working and wants to save enough money for her retirement. Acquiring more loans will enable her to achieve her dreams. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste.

texts.en: Jean Baptiste is 35 years old. He works as a transporter and has been in this business for the past two years. He wants this loan to upgrade his transportation business by adding another motorbike. With the profits from the business, he will reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to upgrade his transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in the small village of Kvareli District, East Georgia. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and three calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. Maia milks cows and produces cheese and sells locally in an open market at a good price. Also,  they have a vineyard and two hectares of agricultural land where maize is grown. The harvested maize and vines are sold locally. Maia is a very hard working woman and has a rich experience in her business. Maia requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle. After purchasing the feed, the livestock will be fattened properly and Maia will produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cattle

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 60 years old and married, with nine children. Jasmin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items like eggs, spices, snack foods, and other groceries.

Jasmin has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like eggs, spices, snack foods, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Randani

texts.en:
Randani is from Mombasa, in the rural area of Tiribe. He is married with four children. He is the owner of a grocery store, running it from his home. He is a very hard-working, responsible, and honest person.

Randani started with a small kiosk where he sold fast food such as soda, bread, cakes and other items,such as ice and drinks.
His dream was always to have a very spacious grocery store so that he could offer good service to each one of his customers. Now, thanks to his efforts, and also the help that Yehu offers, he has his own grocery store.

He is applying for this loan in order to buy more products for his grocery store, because the year-end holidays are approaching, and on those days sales volume increase. This way he can meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to add stocks of basic household items such as flour, detergent, basic grains, etc

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola, de 22 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de alegre y muy atenta. Es conviviente con Gino quien trabaja de  policía. Juntos están habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre. Vive en compañía de sus padres, su hermana, su cuñado y su pareja. La actividad que realiza Paola, es la venta de lubricantes, para lo cual instaló un local alquilado en sociedad con una amiga, donde atiende el mayor tiempo la socia, pues Paola cuenta con empleo como policía en actividad, y tiene turnos rotativos. 
Se inició con éste negocio en sociedad hace más de 08 meses, por la idea y planteamiento de su amiga, compartiendo ganancias equitativas.
Considera el negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, pues se logra vender muchos lubricantes por la demanda y el crecimiento del parque a automotor.
Le gusta el negocio por el ingreso adicional que le genera. Deseando aumentar el personal de atención al público, porque los clientes se incrementan cada día. No le gusta   el desorden que por momentos se ocasiona cuando se llena su local. Pero con los ingresos económicos  le permiten aumentar sus ingresos. Por otro lado tiene planes de continuar y ampliar el negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta con éste  pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse cómoda con su grupo pues los considera ser personas amables y solidarias, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de lubricantes en mayor volumen buscando precios bajos por sus compras, de esa manera obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias y aumentar su stock de mercadería disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Paola is 22 years old and is a hard-working and determined woman, in addition to being kind and very attentive. She is Gino's partner who works as a police officer. Together they live comfortably in her mother's house. She lives in the company of her parents, her sister, her brother-in-law and her partner. Paola's business is the sale of lubricants, for which she set up a rented locale in partnership with a friend, where the partner serves customers the majority of the time, since Paola counts on a job as a policewoman for work, and has rotating shifts.

She started this business in partnership more than 8 months ago, because of the idea and plan of her friend, sharing the profits fairly. She considers the business profitable enough because of the profits that it leaves her, since she succeeds in selling many lubricants because of the demand and the growth of the parking lot.

She likes the business because of the additional income that it generates. She is looking forward to increasing the customer service personnel, because the customers are increasing each day. She doesn't like the disorder that is caused by the minute when her locale fills up. But the financial income allows her to increase her income. On the other hand she has plans to continue and grow the business. Therefore this will be loan number 2 with the microfinance institution. Therefore she counts on this small loan in order to be able to complete her objectives. In addition to feeling comfortable with her group since she considers them to be kind and in solidarity, therefore she commits to completing the payment of her installments.

With the requested amount of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of lubricants in greater volume seeking low prices for her purchases. In this manner she will obtain greater profit margins and increase her stock of merchandise available for sale.

loans.use: to buy lubricants in greater volume.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 37 years old, divorced and lives with her 13-year-old son. Several times, Inga has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Inga, who is working as a saleslady. 

Inga requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Inga will purchase clothes in Turkey at wholesale prices and resell them in her district for a profit. It will be hard work for Inga, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira’s business has witnessed great progress over time. The income helped Njira provide for her children's education well. 

Njira desires to improve the operations, including the duration of work and the amount of food cooked, and this requires more money. She is therefore applying for a loan of 26,300 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase additional foodstuffs like flour and cooking oil, and also utensils, etc.

Njira believes this will increase the overall income from the business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as flour and oil, and also utensils, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Nestor

texts.es: Pedro invirtió su credikiva en mercancias variadas y las vendió muy prontamente, por eso esta muy satisfecho y dice a sus finaciadores que su familia y él está muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido por una institución tan grande, que piensa en los pequeños" En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, con el cual comprará productos naturales y articulos de miscelanea como papelería, fantasia juguetería etc. Con esta inversión espera impactar a sus clients para lograr aumentar sus ventas, especialmente en el mes de Diciembre donde usualmente hay un consumo masivo de los productos que ella vende  y esto es lo que justamente hace de su credikiva todo un éxito. "
texts.en:
Pedro invested his loan from Kiva in different stock items, which he sold very quickly. He is very satisfied with this and would like to tell those who financed the loan that both himself and his family are very grateful for the support received from such a large institution that thinks of small businesses. 

At present he is making a request for another Kiva loan which he will use to buy natural products and other miscellaneous items, such as stationery and children’s toys. With this investment, he hopes to impress his customers in order to increase sales, especially in the month of December when usually there is very high demand for the type of products that he sells. This is what makes his Kiva loan a total success.

loans.use: to buy natural products and miscellaneous items, such as stationery and children’s toys, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 44 years old and married with two children.

Leah is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leah has been farming rice for 21 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

Leah is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is a 53-year-old farmer from Khndzoresk village in the Syunik region. He breeds cattle and cultivates wheat, tomatoes and beans. He does his best in order to get a good harvest. 

He has applied for this loan to purchase 15 lambs. This will help him to increase his agricultural activity and get a high income. 

Samvel lives with his wife, Lusya, who helps her husband with the farm. The loan is very important for Samvel and his wife to get income and cover their daily costs.

loans.use: to buy 15 lambs.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie, 26, is married to a motorist and they have two children. 

Marie owns a boutique and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she wants to add more items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap for sale. 

Marie will use the profits from the business to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap for sale.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señorita María Luisa es soltera y vive con su mama y dos hermanos que están estudiando la secundaria.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto ya que actual mente solo cuentan con una recamara que comparten los 4 integrantes de la familia. Desea construir el cuarto que será para sus hermanos ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio y privacidad en la casa. 
La señorita María Luisa es empleada de una trasportes en el aria de recepción con este sueldo es para pagar el crédito y que su mama de dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales y este ingreso es para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hermanos.
Quiere mejor la calidad de vida de sus hermanos y que su mama tenga un lugar seguro y en las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Srta. María Luisa is single and lives with her mother and her two siblings who are in high school. She is requesting a loan so that she can begin construction of a room since the four members of this family currently share one bedroom. María Luisa wants to build this room for her siblings since they are getting older and need their own space and privacy in the house.

Srta. María Luisa is employed as a receptionist at a transportation company. Her salary will be used to repay the loan while her mother is able to cover the family expenses and the schooling of her siblings by preparing and selling tamales.

María Luisa wants her siblings and her mother to have a better quality of life, so she hopes to provide them a secure home with better conditions.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela de 53 años, es una mujer contenta y entusiasta. Está casada con Marcos con quien tiene 3 hijos, ya mayores. Ahora ella y su esposo viven solos en una localidad de la selva central. Con mucho esfuerzo, Marcela hace 7 años abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Desde las primeras horas del día, los habitantes de la localidad visitan su tienda, pues ellos sabes, lo surtida que se mantiene, para ello tiene que invertir en la compra de mercaderías. “Tener de todo en las vitrinas es mi secreto, desde abarrotes, bebidas, carnes, frutas, verduras, por eso no me faltan clientes”, comenta orgullosa. 
Mientras atiende, también se dedica a la confección y remiendo de prendas de vestir. De esa manera obtiene ingresos extras para cualquier eventualidad. Y como si fuera poco también se dedica ala compra y venta de café. Es muy dinámica a pesar de su edad. Ella requiere de su ayuda para continuar con su negocio. Éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP, que obtendría gracias a su ayuda. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Por su parte menciona sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal “Luz del futuro”, por el trabajo solidario que desempeñan.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería para su tienda de comestibles, así como panetones y algunos juguetes que expenderá por temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Marcela is 53 years old she is a happy and enthusiastic woman. She is married to Marcos with whom she has 3 children who are adults. At present she and her husband live by themselves in the central jungle. With a lot of hard work, Marcela opened a small grocery store some 7 years ago where she sells basic household goods. Early in the mornings the inhabitants of the area visit her store since they know it is well stocked and she needs to invest to buy merchandize. “To have everything in the display cabinets is my secret, from groceries, refreshments, meats, fruits, vegetables, that is why I never lack customers,” she proudly says.

While she cares for her customers she also makes and mends clothing. She gains extra income to keep for whatever emergency. If that is not enough she also buys and sells coffee. Marcela is very dynamic despite her age. She needs your help to keep her business; this is her ninth loan with MFP that she will obtain thanks to your support. This is why she promises to be punctual with her loan quotas and says that is happy with her communal bank, “Light of the Future” for the unified work that they do.

She will use the money to buy merchandize for her small grocery store like panettone and some toys that she will sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: buy panettone and some toys that she will sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: "yalana" Duangpon

texts.en:
Meet Yalana (pronounced Yuh-luh-NA)

Yalana is an artisan hammock weaver and the mother of 3 children. She was one of the first Yellow Leaf weavers and will be a member of our inaugural Kiva microloan class.

Through a zero-interest Kiva loan and the Yellow Leaf distribution network, her family will have guaranteed weaving income and financial stability for the first time in 2013. This is a tremendous step for a woman born in Yalana’s circumstances.  

Yalana was born in the jungles of rural northern Thailand at the end of an era for her tribe, the Mlabri. When she was a young lady life rapidly changed as deforestation destroyed much of the jungles in which the Mlabri had lived for generations.  Without any land rights or capital to farm, she, along with the rest of the tribe, eventually became indentured servants working in the fields of the more aggressive tribes in the area.

Her father was a respected sorcerer and very knowledgeable about traditional Mlabri life.  As encroaching logging and agriculture overwhelmed traditional ways of life, she found herself with few alternatives to servitude. 

Hammock weaving presented an excellent opportunity!  Today she lives in the Ban Bunyuen village and helps provide for her family by applying her traditional artisan talents toward weaving hammocks that are sold around the world.  

She has acquired enough independence to be able to plant rice fields for her family, generally harvesting enough grain to last from one harvest to the next.  Hunting and foraging continue to play a role in her family’s daily sustenance, but they are no longer limited to what they can hunt, trap, catch or kill; her income from making hammocks affords them healthcare, education, and food security formerly unavailable to them.

With her past way of life no longer viable, she has adjusted to her new situation while maintaining her pride and confidence in being a Mlabri person.

With this loan, not only will she will be able to make more money, but she can create a stockpile of hammocks during the off season to ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year.

loans.use: to pay for yarn and ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year.

loans.name: Yadi

texts.en:
Yadi is an artisan weaver living in rural northern Thailand. She is a member of a marginalized hill tribe community known as the Mlabri. 

For almost 1,000 years, the Mlabri lived as a gentle, peaceful hunter-gatherer society, secluded from the outside world. Rapid deforestation, reckless development and warfare in the mid-20th century robbed them of their jungle home and nearly destroyed the tribe's unique lifestyle- they were forced to labor in toxic slash & burn agriculture as indentured servants.
