Malaria and malnourishment decimated the tribe- they are listed on UNESCO's endangered languages list with just 300 Mlabri left in the world.

Yadi was born in the jungles to a traditional Mlabri family as the world around them fell apart. She spent all of her growing up years working as a laborer in the fields, feeling that she had no options to take control of her future. When the opportunity to weave hammocks came along, she leapt at it! She was among the first group to learn and perfect hammock weaving and she has never gone back to being a hired hand again. 

Yadi would like to improve her home-based weaving operation, where she can watch over her younger children, and invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential. 

Yadi is married with six children and she has helped ensure each of them receives the formal education she was denied. The healthy, stable income from weaving hammocks has helped Yadi engineer a turnaround and pull her culture back from the brink of extinction. She looks forward to a brighter future for her family and community.

loans.use: invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is presenting Lea's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, a 54-year-old married mother of nine children, two of whom are in school, has been farming rice in the Philippines for 10 years now. Having received and repaid five previous loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business and continue sustaining her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie, a 32-year-old single woman, has been selling clothes for five years. With this loan, she wants to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esperanza de 64 años de edad, originaria de Granada, es clienta Kiva  que esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le ha brindado Kiva y MiCrédito por el préstamo otorgado ya que pudo invertir  su primer crédito en  su negocio de pulpería con productos por mayor  que demanda el cliente tales como arroz,  azúcar, aceite. Este le permitió incrementar su inventario y sus ventas.
Ella solicita su segundo préstamo para comprar azúcar, frijoles, arroz, gaseosa, etc. Su principal  sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta llegar a ser una microempresaria y ser alguien sostenible que no dependa de créditos con el objetivo de mantener siempre el negocio surtido con todos los productos para satisfacer las necesidades que demanda el cliente y tener un mejor nivel económico.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 64 years old and is originally from Granada, Nicaragua.  She is very grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for her first loan, since she was able to invest the funds in her grocery store and buy products at wholesale such as rice, sugar and oil.  This enabled her to increase her inventory and her sales.

She is seeking her second loan in order to buy sugar, beans, rice, soft drinks and other items.  Her dream is to be able to expand her business so that it becomes self-sustaining and will not require her to take out loans in order to keep her store stocked with the products that her clients need.  This will help her to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es:
Silvia de 45 años, originaria de Granada, madre de 3 hijos  son independiente, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de tortillas, frijoles. Anteriormente ella le ayudaba a su mama a vender las tortillas en el mercado, con escasos recursos económicos ha logrado salir adelante con su esposo. Actualmente se dedica a vender tortillas negocio que inicio con un pequeño préstamo que  le hicieron, sus expectativas es incrementar sus ventas para poder satisfacer  a su clientela.  
Has  solicitado el  préstamo  para comprar  leña, maíz y frijol. Para la  elaboración de sus  tortillas, negocio que considera muy bueno porque obtiene ganancias a diario. Su principal   sueño es poder comprar toda la materia prima que necesita al por mayor, mejorar la infraestructura de su casita.  Pretende mantener siempre estable su negocio y futuramente piensa comprar un terreno para heredarle a sus hijos y  brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Silvia is 45, originally from Granada, she is the mother of three kids that are now independent, she is a merchant that sells tortillas, beans.  Previously she helped her mother sell tortillas at the market, with low economic resources she has been able to get ahead together with her husband.  She currently works selling tortillas, business that she started with a small loan that she got, her expectations are to increase sales to be able to satisfy her customers.  She has requested a loan to buy wood, corn and beans to make her tortillas, business that she considers very good because she has daily profits.  Her main dream is to be able to buy all the inputs she needs at wholesale and improve the infrastructure of her house.  She plans to maintain a stable business and in the future she is thinking of buying a piece of land to inherit to her kids and provide a better quality of life for them.

loans.use: to buy wood, corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lelani

texts.en:
Lelani is 52 years old and married, with six children. Lelani works very hard to provide for them. 

Lelani runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Lelani has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, soft-drinks, and beverages. In the future, Lelani would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella, a 46-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines. Married to Diosdado, a construction worker, and a mother to her children, she manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estrella owns and manages their Side Car transportation business. She has one side car or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their community destinations. Her regular customers are workers and employees in the community. She also sells rice for additional income, earning a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan for the maintenance of her side car. Estrella hopes to expand her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her children a good quality education.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her sidecar.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a 45-year-old, married woman from Bohol, Philippines and a mother of two children. She has run a sari-sari or variety store business for more than five years. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place.

Fortunata is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, cooking oil, soap, and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store, thus giving her the chance to sell more items and augment her income.

In the future, Fortunata hopes of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, cooking oil, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en: Every person wants to have a prosperous life and this is also the desire of this man. Mwinyi is a dedicated man who is very hard working. He has been running a retail shop which has been his main source of income to support his family. For this sole reason, he takes his business very seriously. Thanks to the previous loan that enabled him to establish his clientele, he has increased his income. He wants to expand his business and that is why he is requesting this loan to add to his stock of rice, beans, flour, condiments, noodles, and other instant goods. Mwinyi is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to add to his stock of rice, beans, flour, condiments, noodles, and other instant goods.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 33-year-old single woman. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a food stall where she sells fresh juice. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are schools and students. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of a permanent business place. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy fruits for blending juice to sell. Her business goal is to be a juice distributor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruits for blending juice to sell

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vinani is 29 years old and has been married for nine years. She has three children. Two years ago, she started a small grocery store in her home. Her husband is also a businessman.

Vinani's store is located in the most important and traveled part of the town. The business is growing and her goal is to be able to continue growing her business and being the center of shopping in the town. 

She is asking for this loan to buy foodstuffs in quantity such as drinks and primary needs products like flour, noodles, and rice.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in quantity such as drinks and primary needs products like flour, noodles, and rice.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 10 and 14. She describes herself as ambitious, visionary and hard working. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as delayed payment from customers. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits. 

Her business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Al-Fardos Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Fardos and consists of two women and two men who live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Fakhria is 30 years old. She is the leader of this group and works hard to offer a good life to her family. She has six children who live in Taiz. 

She owns a house and intends to repair it, so she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is from Tiribe, on the southern coast of Kenya. She is 35 years old and married but without children. She owns and operates a water stall in the local community. Zuhura has been engaged in her business for two years and earns KES 12,600 per month. 

She is asking for a loan of KES 10,000 to buy a water tank. She plans to use the additional profit from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel  tiene 24 años de estado civil actual uniòn libre tiene una hija, vive con la  conyugue en la hija en  el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra y vende sus productos en Mocache. 

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, urea, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es tener una finca.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres pasiando con la familia.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 24 years old and lives with his common-law wife and daughter in Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

The office of "El Progresso" is located in the same area and assists farmers who grow rice and corn in short growing cycles.

José Manuel is one such farmer.  He buys and sells his products in Mocache.  He will use the loan funds in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost for his crops.  The loan will help him to increase his income for the well-being of his family.  His dream is to have his own farm.

He very much enjoys spending his free time with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost for his crops.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina es una mujer, humilde, honrada y muy trabajadora, Marina tiene 44 años, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive y por quien lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante y verles crecer sanos y felices. 

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir  en la compra de chanchos, Marina se dedicó a este negocio ya que vio la necesidad de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar mediante la crianza y venta de animales, dándole hasta el momento buenos resultados y mejorando la calidad de vida de sus pequeños hijos. 

El sueño que Marina tiene es poder construir chancheras y tener un gran cantidad de animales para criar y vender, y con estos ingresos mejorar su casita y darles una buena educación a sus hijo, ya que la señora Marina cree que la mejor herencia que puede dejar los padres a sus hijos es la educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina is a humble, honorable and very hardworking woman. She is 44 years old, is a single mother and has three children that she lives with and works hard each day to give them a good start in life and to see them grow healthy and happy.

The loan from Fodemi will be used to buy pigs; Marina began her business since she saw the need to meet her household expenses and started breeding and selling animals. This has given her good earnings and has improved the quality of life of her young children.

Marina’s dream is to be able to build pigpens and have a greater quantity of animals to breed and sell. With the income she wants to make improvements to her home and give her children a good education since Mrs. Marina believes that the best inheritance parents can give their children is an education.

loans.use: buy piglets to raise and sell later on.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de Jesus tiene 41 años es casada, vive con el esposo  y con los  hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

La ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace 15 años.

Mariana de Jesus  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

solicita el crèdito para la compra de semillas, urea, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. El sueño es comprar una casa.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres estando con la familia.
texts.en:
Mariana de Jesus, 41, is married and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the rural community of Aguas frías de Mocache in the Mocache Canton.

The communal bank EL PROGRESO is located in the rural community of Aguas Frías de Mocache, which is part of the Mocache Canton. For fifteen years, this area has been an agricultural belt of short-cycle crops, like corn and rice.

Mariana de Jesus is a farmer who owns her own land on which she plants corn and rice. She buys her supplies in Mocache and then sells her produce in the Mocache market.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and manure for her crops. The loan will help her generate more income for her family and allow her to buy seeds. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys spending her free time with her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
A kind man by the name of Ravshan lives in a house that is in bad condition. He is a careful husband and father. His wife is a pensioner, and his son, who has a wife and two children, helps him with his business. He worked at the collective farm for more than 20 years, and after the decomposition
of the Soviet Union, he began own business in animal husbandry. He has been running this business for more than 20 years. With the profits, he buys all the necessary things for living. Lately, his house has fallen into bad condition. Ravshan needs to repair it, but his income is not enough. He is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy cement and sand to repair his house. In this way, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to repair his house.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Isatu. She is married and has two children ages six and three. They are school-going children. 

In 2008, Isatu established her cosmetics business. She began her business because her father was a diamond dealer. They were living in the Eastern Province where she was attending school. When the war broke out, she and her family had to relocate to the North. Her family has been between East and North whenever there is a cease-fire, which caused her to drop out of school. She joined her mother in her petty trading business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 863,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan to purchase paste, body cream, bathing soap, powder, and eye polish. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business. The loan will add to her capital. She is hard working and competitive. She is grateful for having been given the opportunity to access a loan.  And she is looking forward to repaying this one and acquiring subsequent loans as the loans will help improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Lesetha

texts.en:
Lesetha is a single woman. She has a daughter. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a poultry farm where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the outbreak of disease which affects all the chickens. 

Lesetha will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy chickens to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of chickens  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her daughter since she is the sole provider of her family. 

This is Lesetha's second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited after taking a previous loan of 20,000 KES, which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Christmas and the New Year are approaching, and Fatuma has some orders from her customers to fill. Since this a time when sales are high, she wants to have enough stock to sell. Fatuma says that since her previous loan, her business has been growing and she hopes to expand even more with this new investment. She plans to buy bundles of kangas for sale. This way, she will not only fulfill her customers' demand but also increase sales and income. She is grateful for the support she gets from Yehu and Kiva!

loans.use: to purchase more khangas for sale.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 26-year-old married man with one daughter. For the past three years, Nidal has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. Nidal is asking for a loan from FATEN to help him buy a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Nidal to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income. Nidal is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 32-year-old married woman and is the mother of two children. She has been selling bags since 2010. She used to sell perfumes from her house, but she insisted on improving her living. She changed her type and place of business to a more profitable one, and now she is selling her products at her friend's shop to create a strong base to move forward. 

Today, Hanan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase the variety of products she has for the coming holiday seasons with a special collection of handbags.

This is Hanan's seventh cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good repayment history. Hanan is planning to expand her business in the future by opening her own shop and improving her living.

loans.use: to increase the variety of products she has for the coming holiday seasons.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Norma, de 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Javier de 54 años y sus 3 queridos hijos de 15, 11 y 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Norma consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, su labor empieza cuando se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana comienza con sus ventas diarias, ya que la gente que vive por su barrio sale a trabajar muy temprano. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y persuasiva, lo cual ha hecho que tenga más clientes que la competencia, al principio tenía dificultad con su negocio ya que no sabía mucho de cómo pode realizar esta actividad, pero con el pasar del tiempo fue ganando experiencia y ahora es una excelente vendedora.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se puede enterar de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse tan temprano, ya que por lo general se queda atendiendo hasta muy altas horas de la noche. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, esta comprometida con el grupo que conforman los integrantes del banco comunal al que pertenece, además esta convencida que será una buena cliente, puntual y responsable en sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará productos para poder así ofrecer mayor variedad de cosas a sus clientes que la visitan a diario.
texts.en:
Norma, 42 years old, is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Javier, who is 54 years old, and their three dear children, who are 15, 11 and 5 years of age. She and her husband want to provide a better quality of life for their children.

Norma’s business consists of selling basic necessities. Her work starts after she arises very early to open her food store at approximately 6 a.m. to begin her daily sales to the people in her neighborhood, who leave very early for their own jobs. She is a very happy and persuasive salesperson and this has enabled her to attract more customers than the competition. At first she had difficulty because she did not know much about running a business. However over time, she began gaining experience and now she is an excellent salesperson. 

What she most enjoys about her work is talking with her customers because that is how she learns about the happenings in the neighborhood. She has had her business for 8 years and thinks that her greatest challenge is having to get up so early since she generally continues working until very late at night. 

This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she hopes this collaboration will enable her to continue meeting her goals. She is committed to the members of her communal bank and is convinced that she will be a good client, who is punctual and responsible in making her payments. With the sum requested, S/. 2,000, she will purchase a wider inventory of products to offer her customers, who drop by on a daily basis.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, una persona con valores muy acentuados por sus padres, la honradez, la humildad, el respeto y el trabajo son cualidades que la definen muy bien, siendo un ejemplo para toda su familia, el emprendimiento y la manera de buscar un nuevo sustento para la familia, la llevo a buscar comprar mercadería para luego ir vendiendo por su comunidad, dándole buenos resultados.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi es para la compra de mercadería como sabanas, edredones, cobijas  etc. para distribuir a pequeñas a las tiendas de las comunidades alejadas. Siendo  un trabajo de sacrificio pero que lo hace con mucho amor, sabiendo que cada día de trabajo es un día más que puede llevar un plato de comida su hogar.

El sueño que Doña Gloria tiene es comprarse una camión grande donde pueda ir a vender sus productos, ella está segura que con trabajo lo va a lograr, y con estos ingresos darles la educación universitaria a su hija que todavía dependen de ella.
texts.en:
Gloria is a person with values well-defined by her parents. Honor, humility, respect, and hard work are qualities that define her well, being an example to all of her family. Her entrepreneurship and search for a new way to economically support for her family led her to buy merchandise to later go selling throughout her community, which gave good results.
The loan requested from Fodemi is to buy merchandise like sheets, quilts, blankets, etc., to distribute in small quantities to stores in remote communities. Being a work of sacrifice but one that she does with love, she knows that each day on the job is another day that she can bring a meal home.
Gloria’s dream is to buy herself a large truck where she can go to sell her products. She is sure that with work she will achieve her dream, and with this income she will be able to provide a university education to her daughter who is still dependent on her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as blankets, quilts, sheets, and tablecloths to distribute to communities that are far from the city of Tulcán.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Rosa Idalia de 54 años de edad. Madre soltera con dos hijos de 19, 14 años los cuales están estudiando y están bajo su responsabilidad. Esta mujer se caracteriza por ser responsable trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Ella tiene por actividad económica el servicio de fotocopiadora ubicado en su casa de habitación. Tiene 4 años de tener el negocio, el cual surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio, y también vio la oportunidad ya que cerca no existía nadie con ese tipo de negocio y también que fuera un medio   de trabajo para sacar adelante a  sus dos hijos y poder cumplir el sueño que toda madre tiene como ver formado profesionalmente a sus hijos. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar  cajas de resma de papel bond de carta y legal, papel sellado, darle mantenimiento a los equipos. Rosa ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo  y forma. Rosa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosa Idalia is 54 years old. She is a single mother of two children who are 19 and 14 years old. Both are studying and under her responsibility. This woman is characterized for being a responsible and hard working woman with a desire to get ahead. 

She has a copy store in her home as her source of income. She has had this business for four years due to the need for her to have economic means. She also saw the opportunity because nobody had a business like this nearby and it would be a way to work to get her kids ahead and fulfill the dream that all mothers have: to see her children become professionals. 

This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to buy boxes of bond paper in both letter and legal size, stamped paper and have maintenance done on her machines. Rosa has already worked with the Foundation and has demonstrated her ability to pay on time and in full. Rosa is thankful for the help that Kiva investors bring to those with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of employment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock her copy store business by purchasing letter and legal size bond paper, and stamped paper.

loans.name: Aureliano Darmes

texts.es:
El señor Aureliano es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras.
Don Aureliano tiene un negocio de venta de pescado. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pescado seco, robalo, babosa y pancha. Con el préstamo, espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer a los clientes y obtener más ingresos para mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia. 
Don Aureliano en el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más conocido de la comunidad y  sueña que su familia viva siempre de la mejor manera y que sus hijos continúen sus estudios hasta convertirse en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Aureliano is an honest, responsible and hard working person. He lives with his wife and children in the community of Choluteca in southern Honduras. Aureliano has a business selling fish. He needs the loan to buy dried fish, sea bass, slugs and panchax. With this loan he hopes his sales will increase so that he can have more products to offer his clients and obtain greater earnings to improve his and his family's lifestyle a little bit. 

Aureliano hopes his business will grow in the future and become the most well known fish business of the community. His dream is that his family will always live as well as they can and that his children continue their studies until they become respectable people with better oppportunities.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, sea bass, slugs and panchax.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet, de 33 años convive con Hugo, su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años, a quienes cría y educa en su casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural de la selva central. Yanet es una madre esforzada y afable, se dedica a la agricultura. En sus hectáreas de terrenos tiene sembrado plátanos y plantas de café, los que comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced a las cooperativas cafetaleras quienes le dan buenas ganancias por sus productos. “El café de esta zona es bien solicitado, por eso cuando cosecha lo vendo rápido”, comenta.
Por su parte, Hugo, su pareja, trabaja en el campo en los cultivos, limpiando, abonando y para la cosecha tiene que contratar peones, por ser una faena dura. Y cuando el trabajo en los sembríos cesa. Además considera rentable elaborar viveros de café en su propio hogar, para ello adquiere bolsas especiales, semillas y fertilizantes orgánicos.
“Cada millas lo vendo de 400 a 450 soles”, dice. Yanet espera darles una buena educación a sus hijos para ello seguirá trabajando duro y parejo. Éste  es su préstamo número 7 con MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como lo fue en los ciclos pasados. Además menciona sentirse muy contenta con su banco comunal, “Luz del futuro”, ya que fue una de las fundadoras.
Con los 2000 soles Yanet podrá adquirir más bolsas de abono orgánico para elaborar viveros de café y para sus propios cultivos.
texts.en:
Yanet is 33 years old and lives with her partner, Hugo who is also a father to their 2 children of 12 and 6 years of age who are brought up and educated in their own home located in a rural area in the central jungle. Yanet is a hardworking and good-natured mother who works in agriculture. In her hectares she grows plantains and coffee plants that are sold in the city of La Merced to coffee cooperatives that give her good profits for her products. “The coffee in this area is well sought after, that is why when I harvest it I sell it quickly,” she says.

Hugo, her partner, works in the fields cleaning and fertilizing the crops and has to hire laborers since it is a hard job. It is also considered that it is more profitable to make coffee nurseries in their home and to do that they need special bags, seeds and organic fertilizers.

“Every thousand units are sold between 400 to 450 soles,” Yanet says. She hopes to give her children a good education and that is why she will continue to work hard. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and is committed to being punctual in her payment quotas as she has been in past loans. Yanet also mentions that she is very happy with the communal bank, “Light of the Future” since she is one of the founders.

With the 2000 soles, Yanet will buy more organic manure to make coffee nurseries and for her own crops.

loans.use: Comprar bolsas de abono orgánico.

loans.name: Grupo Empresarial Group

texts.es:
Katherine  es uno de los miembros del grupo Grupo Empresarial

Katherine es soltera y tiene 20 años, actualmente vive en casa de su tía. Katherine se dedica a la venta de verduras, empezó el negocio gracias a su tía que le enseño a trabajar como comerciante, para eso alquila  un puesto en el mercado de su zona donde ofrece todo tipo de verduras y tubérculos, su trabajo es muy sacrificado todos los días tiene que madrugar para comprar productos frescos y a buen precio, sus mayores clientas son las amas de casa que le compran diariamente, por las tardes se dedica a estudiar y su trabajo le permite solventar esos gastos. Katherine desea tener un negocio más grande y  para ese fin  usara su préstamo, para comprar verduras al por mayor, así podra obtener mejores ingresos.
 Katherine esta agradecida a todos los inversionistas de KIVA por apoyarla en su negocio y permitirle seguir progresando. 
Katherine aparece en la fotografía con pantalon rosado y casaca ploma, en la foto del lado derecho aparece el Sr. Filiberto con pantalon jean y camisa celeste.
texts.en: Katherine is one of the members of the “Empresarial” group.  She’s single and 20-years-old and is living in her aunt’s house.  Katherine works selling vegetables.  She started the business thanks to her aunt who taught her how to be a merchant.  She leases a stand in her local market where she sells all types of vegetables and tubers.  Her work is very demanding.  She must rise at dawn every day to buy fresh products at good prices.  Her best customers are housewives who buy from her daily.  In the afternoon she studies and her work covers those costs.  Katherine wants to have a bigger business and will use the loan towards that end, to buy vegetables at wholesale and earn higher income.  Katherine is grateful to all Kiva lenders for supporting her business and allowing her to continue to make progress.  In the photo, Katherine appears wearing pink pants and a gray shirt. On the right hand side is Sr. Filiberto wearing jeans and a light blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Miguel Filiberto

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Filiberto ya ha tenidos créditos con KIVA los cuales a pagado puntualmente y los cuales fueron para invertir en su negocio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para el cambio de la instalación eléctrica en todo el local ya que actualmente esta en malas condiciones y no quiere que por no atenderlo a tiempo puede causar un problema mayor ya sea algún corto que ocasioné un incendio. Por lo cual esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito para renovar dicho cableado.
El señor Miguel Filiberto es empleado de una compañía de seguridad y también recibe una pensión porque fue militar, con estos ingresos es para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijas y que con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio es para pagar el crédito.
Desea mejorar su negocio y que este mas seguro para sus clientes como para la familia ya que su esposa le ayuda a tender el negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Filiberto has had several Kiva loans to invest in his business and he has paid them back punctually.

He's requesting a loan to change the electricity because it's currently in bad condition.  He wants to take care of it so it won't cause a major problem or a short circuit that starts a fire.  This is why he's requesting your cooperation in this loan to renovate the wiring.
 
Miguel Filiberto is employed by a security company and he also receives a pension because he was in the military.  These incomes are for family expenses and his two daughters' school expenses.  The profits from his business sales are to pay back the loan.

He wants to improve his business and make it safer for his customers and his family, because his wife helps him look after the business.

loans.use: to install electricity in his store

loans.name: Pauline P.

texts.en:
Pauline P. is 30 years old. She has been working hard with her business for the past seven years. She is married and a mother of two children, 2 and 5 years old. They live with Pauline P. at Congo Town and are attending school. 

Pauline P. sells six days per week, from 7am to 5pm. She sells imported women's handbags, head ties, and lappers (country cloth). She learned to sell from her mother. She started this business with a small amount of money that she received from the saving club. 

Because of the quality material that she sells, she makes a profit every day. She uses some of the profit to buy more goods and to help with the expenses of the family. 

Pauline P. has requested a loan to purchase more imported lappers, handbags, and head ties for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more imported lappers (country cloth), handbags, and head ties for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for resale, such as bricks and sand.

loans.name: Diva

texts.es:
Diva, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, también es amable y cordial.  Es conviviente con Eber  quien es empleado.  Vive en compañía solo de su pareja, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa, la cual construyo con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Diva es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su propia casa,  donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganarse  su aceptación y así la recomiendan con otras personas que luego se vuelven en sus clientes habituales. Se inicio hace más de 01 año en éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando  ella sola. Considera rentable su actividad por las ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta el oficio de la costura por la ocupación que le brinda, que le valió para apoyar a su pareja en solventar los gastos de su hogar. Pero comenta que le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico por estar sentada en una misma postura que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Por tanto tiene  planes de ampliar su negocio y comprarse otras maquinas de coser para poder montar un pequeño taller en casa. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP.  Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen historial crediticio que le permita el acceso a créditos futuros.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en arreglar su  maquina  que sirve para realizar su costura y con el saldo tiene planeado comprar materiales de costura como telas, hilos, y demás, buscando precios bajos por su compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Diva, 29 years of age, is a happy woman with desire for self-improvement. She is also kind and cordial. Her partner is Eber, who is employed. She lives in the company of only her partner, comfortably set up in their own home, which they built with much effort. Diva is a dressmaker, a trade that she learned studying in a center for occupational education. She then bought a sewing machine with her savings, which she installed in her own home, where she serves her customers who seek her out for her good finishing touches. She succeeds in gaining their acceptance and thus they recommend her to other people who then become her regular customers. She started in this business more than 1 year ago, and until this moment she does it alone. She considers her business profitable because of the profits that it brings her.

She likes the trade of dressmaking because of the occupation that it offers her, which is useful to her to support her partner in settling the expenses of their home. But she comments that she feels a little uncomfortable from the physical tiredness from being seated in the same posture which causes her shoulder pain, but this does not discourage her and she continues working and making efforts. Therefore she has plans to expand her business and buy herself other sewing machines to be able to assemble a little workshop in her house. Therefore this will be her loan number 2 with the microfinance institution. That's why she is counting on its collaboration in order to be able to make her plans concrete. Therefore she commits to fulfill her payment of her installments to have a good credit history which allows her access to future loans.

With the requested amount of 800 PEN she will invest in repairing her machine which serves to do her dressmaking and with the balance she has planned to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread and so on, seeking low prices for her volume purchases.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de 52 anos de edad, casada con un hijo de 18 anos el cual esta estudiando, ella es originaria del Malpaisillo, lugar  que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. María Isabel tiene por actividad económica la venta de leche desde hace 10 anos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. María Isabel ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma en  los  créditos anteriores. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y compra leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos. María Isabel agradece la ayuda que los inversionista kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 52, is married with one 18-year-old son who is in school.  She is a native of Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern region of the country.  

María Isabel has made a living by selling milk for ten years.  The business she has is located in her home.  María Isabel has shown her responsibility to pay on time and in full through the previous loans.  Her goal with the loan is to invest in working capital, buy milk to sell, and to get a better income.  

María Isabel is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and in the purchase and sale of milk.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Es separada del padre de sus hijos siendo ella  padre y madre para sus3  hijos. Vive en compañía de sus  2 hijos Mayra de 18 años, Naomi de 13 años de edad, quienes son su motivo para salir adelante. Habita la casa de su hermana  en compañía de sus padres, hijos y 1 sobrino. El negocio que tiene Florinda es la venta de comidas, como juanes, pescados asados, tamales y otros,  que lo realiza de lunes a viernes por las noches, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, instalándose en la esquina de su casa con una mesa y algunas sillas. Además cuenta con una refrigeradora que usa para helar bebidas gasificadas que pone a la venta.
Realiza éste negocio desde hace 16 años contando con la ayuda de su madre iniciándose con un capital propio. Esta actividad lo realiza con sus hijas quienes atienden con mucha amabilidad.
Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues logra vender todo los que prepara a diario gracias a la acogida que tiene con sus clientes.
Le gusta cocinar pues aprendió de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, además del ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. No le gusta el cansancio físico ya que tienen que levantarse muy de temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio.
Por eso desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus mesas y sillas donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Este es el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP. Por ello cuenta con  su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además dice estar cómoda con su grupo comunal pues  considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de víveres, bebidas gasificadas, mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para renovar  sus enseres, de esa manera espera tener mayor acogida de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Florinda is 37 years old. She is a hard-working, persevering woman, who is also warm and friendly. She is separated from the father of her children, so she is father and mother for her three children. She lives with two of her children; Mayra, 18 and Naomi,13, who are the reason she keeps going. She lives in her sister's house, with her parents, children, and a nephew. 

Florinda's business is selling meals such as juanes (chicken mixed with rice, wrapped in a banana leaf), grilled fish, tamales and other dishes. She does this from Monday to Friday in the evenings, serving her customers in a very friendly way. She is popular with customers, and has managed to have good demand by setting herself up at the corner of her home with a table and some chairs. In addition, she has refrigerator, which she uses to keep cold the soft drinks she sells. 

She has been in this business for 16 years, having her mother's help, and starting up with her own capital. She carries on her business with her daughters, who serve customers in a very friendly way. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings it provides; she manages to sell everything she prepares daily, thanks to how popular she is with her customers. 

She likes to cook, as she learned the secrets of tasty cooking from her mother, and also likes the income that allows her to pay her bills and household expenses. She doesn't like the physical tiredness, as they have to get up very early in the morning for their daily preparations. But that doesn't discourage her, and she continues in her business. That is why she wishes to expand her business and upgrade her tables and chairs, so that she can serve her customers more comfortably. 

This is her sixth loan with the MFP institution. Therefore she counts on your cooperation so that she can make her plans a reality. In addition she says that she is comfortable with her communal bank group, as she considers the members to be responsible people.  

With the amount applied for of 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy supplies, soft drinks, tables, chairs and kitchen utensils, so that she can update her  equipment. That way she hopes to have even greater popularity with her customers.

loans.use: To buy supplies, soft drinks, tables, chairs and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter de 31 años de edad, soltero sin hijo. Es originario del municipio de Malpaisillo. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Walter tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía y cerdos en pie, de forma ambulante desde hace 11 años que se dedica  a dicha actividad. Negocio que consisten en vender artesanía de barro como jarrones de barro, casitas de barro, saleros de barros, muñecas de barro, y cerdos los cual compra lote de cerdos para la venta del mismo. Él ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo  y forma. Walter se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, responsable. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de artesanía y cerdos y aprovechar las mejores ventas en el mes de diciembre. Walter agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medido de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Walter, 31, is single and does not have children. He is from the municipality of Malpaisillo, in the western part of the country. Walter sells handicrafts and live pigs on the streets and he has been doing it for eleven years. He sells handicrafts made of clay, like jars, little model-houses, salt shakers and dolls, and he also buys pigs and sells them.

Walter has worked before with the foundation and has proved to be responsible by paying on time and the right amounts. He is known to be a hardworking, responsible person. His goal with this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business up with more handicrafts and pigs, taking advantage of the upcoming season, which is good for sales.

Walter appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give to people with few resources from poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his business by buying clay handicrafts and live pigs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and a more modern equipment for his auto body shop.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda, de 55 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos y sus nietos ya que hace algunos meses se separo de sus esposo con quien tuvo muchos años de matrimonio, pero como es una mujer fuerte y luchadora está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para más adelante poder vivir una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Rayda consiste en la venta de productos en su pequeña pero muy implementada tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa, son 16 horas diarias las que pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las 6 de la mañana y atiende todo el día de corrido hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche, su bodega es una de las más concurridas de barrio, ya que sus vecinos saben que ahí siempre encuentran lo que necesitan, al principio tuvo muchos problemas y dificultades, pero con el pasar del tiempo entendió mejor el sistema de trabajo de este negocio y ahora trabaja muy bien y tranquila.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 06 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, esta comprometida con el grupo que conforman los integrantes del banco comunal al que pertenece, además esta convencida que será una buena cliente, puntual y responsable en sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará productos para su bodega además de implementarse con la venta de bebidas y chupetes.
texts.en:
Rayda is 55 years old she is a very kind and easygoing woman, she lives in her own home with her two children and grandchildren since a few months ago she separated from her husband with whom she had many years of marriage. She is a very strong and hardworking woman and is determined to work hard to have a tranquil old age. Rayda’s job is to sell products in her small but very organized grocery store that she has in her home, she spends 16 hours a day in her store that she opens at 6 a.m. and is open all days until about 10 p.m. Her pantry is one of the most visited in the neighborhood since her neighbors know that they will always find what they need. At first Rayda had many problems and difficulties but as time went on she learned more about the business and now works very well and calmly.

What she enjoys most about her work is getting to talk with her neighbors and knowing things that happen in her neighborhood. She has worked for a year in this field and says that the most difficult aspect of her work is spending all day in the store and not being able to go outside. With time Rayda hopes that her business will grow and that she will have better income. This will be her sixth loan with MFP and hopes for your support to keep going after her goals, she is committed with the group that make up her communal bank that she belong to and is convinced that she will be a good customer, punctual and responsible in her payment quotas.

The amount needed is 2000 soles that will be used to buy merchandize for her small grocery store including refreshments and candy.

loans.use: refreshments and candy.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 44 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilmer de 41 años y sus 4 queridos hijos de 25, 18, 15 y el menor de 7 años, de los cuales solo el mayor es independiente y los demás aun dependen de ella para su futuro y a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El secreto de Rosa para poder lograr mejorar su negocio cada día, se debe a que su bodega de  es la primera en abrirse en su barrio, desde las 5 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan, cuando se indicio tenia muy pocos productos y sus ventas no eran tan buenas, pero con el pasar del tiempo pudo armar de mejor manera su tienda y ahora tiene de todo un poco.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y conversar con su cliente, lleva 20 años con este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para atender su bodega, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 17 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and is a very friendly and hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her 41 year old husband Wilmer and their four lovely children of 25, 18, 15 and 7 years of age. Only the oldest is independent and the rest still depend on her for their future. She hopes to bring them a better quality of life. 

Rosa's secret in improving her business each day is due to the fast that it is the first store to open in her neighborhood. At 5:00 am her doors are already ready to receive the morning shoppers. Knowing the variety of merchandise that she has in her store, they do not hesitate to buy from her. They already know that they are going to find the things they need. When she began she had very few products and her sales were not so good but with the pass of time she has been able to better stock her store and now has a little bit of everything. 

What she likes most about her job is selling to and chatting with her customers. She has had this business for 20 years and considers that the most difficult aspect is having to get up early to attend to her store, but she knows that this is her job and she must do it. She hopes that in the future her business will grow and provide her with improved earnings. This will be her 17th loan with MFP and she awaits the collaboration to continue with her objectives. On another hand she is committed once again to make her loan installments as she has done with previous loans. She is thankful to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive. 

With the amount solicited of 2000 soles, she will buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to better stock her store.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela es una persona adulta responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Ella es originaria del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ángela ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Ángela tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consisten en la compra y venta de pantalones, faldas, blusas, short, camisetas, ropa interior. El objetivo del préstamo es  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para brindar mejor servicios a sus clientes. Ángela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ángela is a responsible adult, with the desire to improve herself.  She is from the department of León, which is located in the west of the country. Ángela has already worked with this microfinance partner and has shown that she pays on time and in full.  Ángela sells general merchandise, which consists of buying and selling pants, skirts, blouses, shorts, t-shirts, and lingerie.  

The goal of this loan is to allow her to invest in working capital and to supply her business so she can offer a better service to her clients. Ángela thanks Kiva lenders for the support they give people with few resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua so they can work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to support the buying and selling of merchandise, such as pants, skirts, blouses, shorts, t-shirts, and lingerie.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: Ana Cristina tiene una miscelánea donde vende artículos de papelería, ropa, calzado, fantasía, cosméticos etc. Sus ventas las realiza de contado  y también aplica  créditos a algunos clientes; ella abre sus puertas desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche de cada día, esto hace que su clientela conozca que allí en ese horario, pueden encontrar los artículos que ellos requieren, porque Ana Cristina está atenta a complacerlos siempre. Sus principales clientes están ubicados en la comunidad donde habita y en sectores aledaños a ella. Cada vez que se presenta una temporada, donde usualmente se incrementan las ventas, para Ana Cristina, tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para complacerlos a todos,  es un desafío; esto es justamente lo que ocurre en Diciembre, época de grandes satisfacciones familiares,  porque se incrementa el consumo de su clientela y sus ingresos también aumentan. Razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado y artículos navideños,  para complacer a su clientela y continuar fidelizándolos, mientras ella estaría aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ana Cristina has a general store where she sells stationary products, clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, makeup, etc. Her sales are made cash on hand and on credit to some customers. She opens her store at 8 a.m. and closes at 8 p.m. everyday, this makes her customers know that between the hours that the store is open they can find whatever they need because Ana Cristina is thoughtful enough to please her customers. Her customers are from her neighborhood and surrounding areas. Each season sales increase and Ana Cristina needs enough work capital to please her customers, it is challenge and during December she gets great family satisfaction because her customers buy more and her income increases as well. That is why she needs a credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with it she will buy clothing, shoes and Christmas merchandize to please her customers and to keep them loyal all the while she increases her income.

loans.use: buy blouses, jeans, and elegant clothing in greater quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable. Vive en compañía de  su esposo Arbildo  quien es jubilado y sus 03  hijos de 39, 36 y 35 años y su nieto de 2 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Zoila es la venta de comidas, como menús que lo realiza de lunes a viernes atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, además los domingos venden parrilladas de pollos, realizando este negocio desde hace 15 años contando con la ayuda de su hija, iniciándose con un capital de un préstamo particular.
Le gusta su negocio pues comenta le gusta cocinar aprendiendo de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. Al contrario no le gusta por el cansancio físico ya que tienen que levantarse muy de temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio, por eso desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar su techado donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 16 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además dice estar cómoda con su banco comunal ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles lo  invertirá en el arreglo de su piso colocando cemento y techar su locaol para así atender más cómodamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zoila, 57, is a hard-working and determined woman in addition to being happy and friendly. She lives in the company of her husband Arbildo, who is retired, and her three children of the ages 35, 36, and 39.  They are comfortable in their own home.  The business that Zoila has is the sale of food, like prepared meals, from Monday to Friday while very kindly attending to her customers.  She manages to have good reception and demand.  She also sells grilled chicken on Sundays.  She has been doing this business for 15 years, relying on the help of her daughter. She began it herself with the capital from a private loan.

She says she like her job because she enjoys cooking (having learned from her mother the secrets to a good seasoning) as well as for the financial income that allows her to pay her bills and cover the household expenses.  On the contrary, she does not like it due to the physical fatigue from having to get up very early in the morning to make preparations for the day.  But this does not discourage her and she carries on with her work, which is why she wishes to grow her business and improve her roof so she can more comfortably tend to her customers.  Thus, this will be her 16th loan with the MFP institution, and with it she hopes to be able to settle her plans.  Furthermore, she says she is comfortable with her communal bank since she considers the members to be responsible people.

With the requested amount of 3000 soles, she will invest in fixing up her floor by pouring cement and in roofing her shop in order to more comfortably take care of her customers.

loans.use: to buy cement and hire workers.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Valor Group

texts.es: Buenas Tardes. El grupo “Fuerza  y Valor” conformado por 07 mujeres luchadoras que con el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeras. Carla de 19 años es conviviente, con 01 hijo la cual ha sido su mayor motivo para seguir mejorando cada día. Ella se dedica a la venta de refresco y chupete de hielo. Su madre fue quien la motivo a emprender dicho negocio.  Se siente feliz pues gracias a su trabajo puede aportan con los gastos del hogar. Solicito el crédito para la compra de frutas y vasos. Su mayor deseo es de construir su vivienda. Agradece a los que hicieron posible este crédito. Carla es la primera del lado derecho viste casaca a rayas y pantalón rosado.
texts.en: Good afternoon.  The group "Fuerza y Valor" (strength and effort) is formed by seven hardworking women that through time have demonstrated responsibility and solidarity with their co-members.  Carla is 19, has a partner and a son that has been her reason to get better every day.  She sells soda and popsicles.  Her mother is who motivated her to start this business.  She feels happy because thanks to her work she can help with the expenses at home.  She requested the loan to buy fruits and cups.  Her greatest wish is to build a house.  She is thankful to everyone that made this loan possible.  Carla is the first from the right, she is wearing a top with stripes and pink pants.

loans.use: to buy fruits and cups.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now.

Geraldine is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of their fishing boat, such as wood, paint, and nails. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the boat so that it will be used for their business.

In the future, Geraldine hopes of expanding the fishing business and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat, such as wood, paint, and nails.

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.es: Emeterio, tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro. El señor Emeterio desde pequeño se ha dedicado  a la agricultura, hace aproximadamente 40 años de ser productor de maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en los mercados locales de la cuidad. Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos y darle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo actual de maíz, con ello espera sacar mejores cosechas. También preparar mejor su terreno ya que Su plan es que los cultivos sean mejores en cada temporada y de las ganancias poder vivir mejor.
texts.en: Emeterio, 62, is married and has five children.  He lives in a village in Morazán municipality, Yoro.  He’s worked in agriculture since he was a boy and has been growing corn and beans for about 40 years now.  He sells his products in local markets in the city.  He’s currently asking for a 7,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer and manure to provide good care for his current corn crop; he hopes to get better crop yields and also to prepare the soil better because his plan is that crops improve each season and produce profits so he can live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for his corn crop.

loans.name: Mirtala

texts.es:
La Señora Mirtala tiene 23  años de edad,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del municipio de Victoria, Departamento de Yoro.
Mirtala aprendió la agricultura de sus padres desde muy pequeña, ella en este momento se dedica a la producción de maíz para la venta.
Decidió obtener un préstamo con ODEF por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en el pago de mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes e insumos para la asistencia técnica del cultivo de maíz.
Manifiesta sentirse motivada ya que anteriormente solicitaba dinero al crédito a personas particulares de su comunidad a intereses muy altos.
Ella espera mejorar los rendimientos productivos y la calidad del grano, lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos.
Con las utilidades que reciba, Mirtala piensa apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio preescolar.
texts.en: Mirtala, 23, is married and has two children.  She lives in the company of her family in a community in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro Department.  Mirtala learned agriculture from her parents when she was still very little and at the moment works growing corn to sell.  She decided to get an ODEF loan for 10,000 Lempiras to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer and other supplies to provide corn crop care.  She states that she’s encouraged because she used to get money from private individuals in her community at very high interest rates.  She hopes to improve her productive yields and the quality of the grain which will lead to higher income.  With profits earned, Mirtala intends to help pay for her children’s preschool.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a 34-year-old married mother of six children who lives in Tiribe, Kenya. She has only completed secondary school. She has been running a grocery store for one year. Mejumaa is working very hard to get her family ahead and give them everything they deserve. 

She has attracted more customers and she wants to expand her kiosk. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) in order to supply her business with more merchandise.

loans.use: to add stock of foodstuffs, cleaning products, and basic medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José Santos de 64 anos de edad, casado con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, del departamento de León. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. José Santos tiene por actividad económica la venta granos básicos y kiosko. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de  la localidad. Tiene 29 anos de tener el negocio. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo por la falta de empleo fijo y de dicha forma  obtener ingresos para los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, trigo, cereales, y la venta del kiosco productos  como, galletas, pan, gaseosas, jugos, reposterías, meneítos, tortillitas, yuca fritas. José santos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
José Santos, 64, is married and has three adult children.  He's from the department of León, in the western part of the country.

José Santos's job is selling staples and kiosk items.  His business is in a fixed location in town.  He has had the business for 29 years.  It came about because he lacked a regular job but he needed an income for the household expenses.

He needs the loan to invest in working capital and stock his store with rice, beans, sugar, wheat, and cereals, and kiosk products such as cookies, bread, soda, juice, pastries, cheese snacks, "tortillitas," and fried yucca.

José Santos is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a means for a decent job.

loans.use: to buy food to stock his store

loans.name: Dugarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dugarmaa, 39 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. In 2002, the family came to Darkhan from Dornod, in the eastern province of Mongolia. They settled on another person’s plot of land, where they bred livestock and sold  products such as milk, meat, and skins.

In 2010, Dugarmaa worked as a chicken breeder and in 2012, she began to work as a waitress in a private business entity. Her husband once worked as an engineer in a private business entity and now breeds livestock. Using their accumulated savings, the wife and husband purchased their plot of land, where they built their own barnyard.

Their eldest daughter studies at high school while other three go to secondary school. The family resides in a ger (the Mongolian traditional home). Now the family owns five milk cows and she sells bottles of milk to local residents.

In order to generate more income, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to purchase one more cow. By doing so, she can contribute to the household income and increase the opportunities for their childrens' educations. Recently the family can’t afford to build their own house, but Dugarmaa is a very hardworking individual who believes in a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Del Hogar Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Guisela Marcela, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, es casada. Ella forma parte del grupo "Las Triunfadoras del Hogar", es un grupo que recién se ha formado, escogieron ese nombre por ser la mayoría amas de casa que generan sus ingresos mediante un pequeño negocio que pueden desarrollarlo en casa. Éste grupo está formado por 8 socias.
La Sra. Guisela Marcela, se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de ropa a base de pedidos, a la vez ya que ella cuenta con la habilidad de hacer trabajos manuales, aprovecha las temporadas de fiesta para preparar sus adornos, en ésta ocasión aprovechará las festividades navideñas para preparar sus adornos, muñecos, ect para ofrecerlos en venta.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para desarrollar su proyecto de negocio.
texts.en:
Guisela Marcela, 36, is married and has five children.  She’s part of the “Las Triunfadoras del Hogar” (Home Winners) group which is newly-formed.  They chose that name because most of them are housewives who generate their own income by means of small businesses they can run from home.  The group has 8 members.

Guisela Marcela has been selling clothes on order for six years and she says that she also does handcrafts and takes advantage of festive dates to make decorations.  On this occasion, she’ll take advantage of the Christmas festivities to make decorations, dolls, etc. to put on sale.  She will use the granted loan to buy supplies to carry out this business project.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Teodosia, tiene 34 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos pequeños, ellos son su motor y motivos para trabajar y salir adelante con la ayuda de su pareja.
Hace cuatro meses junto con 4 personas mas, formó un grupo para solicitar crédito para invertir cada una en sus negocios, así formaron el grupo "Las Azucenas del Rosario".
Teodosia se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catalogo, ella ofrece sus productos a amigos, vecinos y familiares. Paralelamente vende ropa y atiende un pequeño puesto de venta de emoliente.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder tener un stock de productos de belleza, aprovechar la campaña navideña tanto para adquirir los productos en oferta, como para venderlos y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 34 years old. She has four small children that are her heart and reason for working and moving forward with the help of her partner.

Four months ago, along with 4 other people, she formed a group to apply for a loan for investing in each of their businesses. The group is named "Las Azucenas del Rosario" (The lilies of the Rosary).

Teodosia has dedicated herself to the the sale of catalog beauty products for the past two years. She offers her products to friends, neighbors and relatives. At the same time, she sells clothing and has a small stand selling emollient.

She is requesting a loan in order to have a stock of beauty products to take advantage of the Christmas season by purchasing the products currently on offer and selling them to get higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Blanca Ubelia

texts.es: Doña Blanca tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, ellos residen en la comunidad de sonaguera, Colon. Ella inicio su negocio desde hace seis años con un pequeño crédito que obtuvo de FAMA OPDF pudo establecer un negocio de venta de golosinas, actualmente continua con el mismo negocio y también tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual desea ampliar,  doña Blanca atiende sola su negocio y la atención al cliente comienza desde las 8: am y culmina a las 9:00 pm. El crédito que doña Blanca solicita lo necesita para ampliar el negocio de la pulpería ya que el de venta de comida lo tiene bien establecido. Su mayor desafío es poder ahorrar para comprar un vehículo y así ofrecer a sus clientes servicio a domicilio. Su sueño es establecer un comedor y un minisúper en locales diferentes. Doña Blanca ha sido cliente de FAMA por nueve ciclos y todos sus créditos los ha cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
