Blanca, 42, is the single mother of two children.  They live in the community of Sonaguera, Colón.  She started her business six years ago with a small loan she got from FAMA OPDF.  She managed to set up a business selling sweets.  Currently she continues with the same business and also has a small grocery store, which she wants to expand.  Blanca looks after the store alone and serves customers beginning at 8 a.m. and ending at 9 p.m.

Blanca needs the loan she's requesting to expand her grocery store business because her food sales are well established.

Her greatest challenge is being able to save to buy a vehicle to give her customers home service.  Her dream is to set up a dining room and a mini-market in various locales.  Blanca has been a client of FAMA for nine cycles and she has paid back all her loans punctually.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 35-year-old married man with five children who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been working a small traditional block factory for 9 years. He was working with his dad and uncle and got great experience, then he collected the money to own his own business. He works hard to earn a profit and improve his living standards. He applied for a loan of 300000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his business.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en: Mwari is a dedicated woman who lives with her husband and five children in the rural area of Tiribe. She is 38 years old and has been running a small business selling fish from her home. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Through this business, she has been able to provide for her children and pay for their education. Mwari is asking for a loan to add stock of fish for her business. She feels happy and responsible by helping her husband in the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to add stock of fish for her business.

loans.name: Scarlett Del Carmen

texts.es:
Scarlett, 28 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 1 hijo con 9 años, de oficio comerciante. Inicio trabajando a la edad de 22 años a otras personas en una tienda, fue allí donde obtuvo experiencia de cómo funcionaba el negocio y con el tiempo ella decidió poner la renuncia en la tienda  y con la liquidación,  estableció su propio negocio del que es propietaria hace mas de 6 años, ya que ella cuenta con el apoyo de su mama y esposo. Sus expectativas es ampliar el negocio para agregar más productos a su inventario.
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar  más ropa como vestidos, faldas, blusas, etc. Ya que ella considera que al comprar   esta mercadería de alta demanda, podrá  satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuros  es diversificar  su negocio y  establecer otro negocio como es una comideria,  sus  metas próxima es invertir en su negocio para cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
Scarlett, 28, is from Granada.  She’s married and is the mother of a 9-year-old son.  She’s a merchant by profession.  She started working for others at the age of 22 in a store and that’s where she learned how the business operated and in time she decided to quit her job and with her severance pay started her own business which she’s now owned for more than six years.  Her mother and her husband help her with it.  Her expectation is to expand the business to add more items to her inventory.

She’s asking for the loan to buy more clothes like dresses, skirts, blouses, etc. because she believes that by buying these items that are in high demand she will be able to meet her customers’ needs.  Her future plan is to diversify the business and open a new one like a snack bar.  Her immediate goal is to invest in the business to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy more clothes like dresses, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Nazanin

texts.en:
Nazanin is a 39-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has two years experience with a small home based business activity. She has been able to build up a nice clientele in the past years and would like to continue providing high quality products for them. Currently her work area is a small space on the foyer between the main entrance and the kitchen in her house. She would like to improve her work conditions and renew her work area. To be able to pay for the work she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $2400.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work conditions and renew her work area.

loans.name: Shirin

texts.en:
Shirin is one of Relief International Microfinance Iraq programs' successful clients who have been featured on Kiva before. With the support of Kiva lenders, she is making small but significant improvements to her sewing and tailoring business.

Shirin continues doing great work from her home-based sewing business. Using her previous loan, which she has successfully repaid, she was able to purchase a new sewing machine with an old stand and a chair. While in the past, she was working on a small machine mounted on a small wooden stool that she had to sit next to on the floor and bend over while working, she is now able to work in a more comfortable position. She is now able to work more hours and satisfy more customers with her services. 

To make further improvements to her small business, she is now taking a new loan of 2,400 USD. She would like to make her work area a better and nicer place for her work. As an example, she imagines some nice small furniture items to better store her work materials and orders, which currently line the floor in small bags. She would also like to buy some nice good quality fabrics and raw materials to work with, making it easier for her to create quality products for her customers, and help support her family.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and buy quality raw materials

loans.name: Nolvia Ivonne

texts.es: Nolvia, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa. hace 10 meses ella compro el negocio de pulpería a otra persona y mediante su administración se ha visto el crecimiento, ella vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, harina, azúcar, manteca, jabón, churros, condimentos, café, productos enlatados, carnes, embutidos, refrescos y otros productos de abarrotería. Ella quiere incrementar el inventario con variedad de productos y continuar manteniendo su clientela. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF con este actual, el cual es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir para surtir más el negocio y que se mantenga activo ya que es su fuente de ingresos. Su meta es ampliar más el local ya que es muy pequeño y va en crecimiento.
texts.en: Nolvia, 35, is married and has two children; she lives in a village in the municipality of San Francisco de Yojoa.  She bought a grocery store business ten months ago from another person and thanks to her management she’s seen it grow.  She sells basic staples like rice, flour, sugar, lard, soap, packaged snacks, condiments, coffee, canned goods, meats, sausages, soft-drinks and other grocery items.  She wants to increase inventory with a variety of products to continue retaining her customers.  She’s asking for her second ODEF loan for 15,000 Lempiras to buy stock merchandise for her store so it will stay in business since it’s her source of income.  Her goal is to expand the space more because it’s very small and business is growing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a 32-year-old mother living with her husband and four children. She has a small locale where she sells snacks and some food products. With her smile, she welcomes her customers in her business. 

She describes herself as a responsible person who is dedicated to her job. Masika wants to grow her business but the main challenge she faces is lack of enough capital to make some new investments.

Now Masika has applied for this loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, raw potatoes, cooking oil, etc. Her goal is to own a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, raw potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Alba Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Alba tiene 28  años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de sus padres, hermanos e hijos en una comunidad del municipio de Victoria, Departamento de Yoro.
Alba se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de café desde hace 10 años.
Manifiesta que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad por la necesidad de generar ingresos que le permitan la manutención de sus hijos.
Con el propósito de brindar una asistencia adecuada al cultivo de café, ha solicitado un préstamos por la suma de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en el pago de mano de obra para la cosecha y compra de fertilizantes para abonar el cultivo.
Ella espera mejorar la producción en su finca y lograr una fuente de ingresos estable para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Alba, 28, is a single mother of two children.  She lives with her parents, siblings and children in a community in Victoria municipality, Yoro Department.  Alba has worked in agriculture specifically growing coffee for ten years.  She states that she decided to go into this activity because she needed to generate income to support her children.  

Aiming at providing proper maintenance to her coffee crop, she’s requested a 10,000 Lempira loan to pay labor costs for harvesting and to buy fertilizer to nourish the crop.  She hopes to improve her farm’s productivity and to attain a stable source of income for her family’s benefit.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be a humble and caring man. 

Michael operates a motorcycle business where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located at a strategic business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area and local disturbances by local authorities. 

Michael will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy vegetables and fruits for starting a grocery store. 

His business goal is to own many taxis for increasing the mode of transportation services to customers within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with profits generated from the business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for starting a new business of a grocery store.

loans.name: Mirian Margoth

texts.es:
Marian Margoth tiene 30 años es casada, vive con la esposa  e  hijos. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace cuatro años.

Mirian Margoth  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra  y vende los productos en Mocache.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. Su sueño es sembrar màs maìz.

Disfruta mucho practicando la lectura y practicando el deporte.
texts.en: Mirian Margoth, 30, is married living with her husband and children in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, Mocache Canton.  The “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache that belongs to Mocache Canton.  This communal bank has been involved with short-cycle corn and rice agriculture for four years.  Mirian Margoth works growing corn and rice.  She buys and sells products in Mocache.  She requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure for the crops.  The loan has helped her increase income for her family and to buy fertilizer for the crops.  Her dream is to plant more corn.  She enjoys reading and playing sports very much.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 22-year-old married young man and a father to one son.

For the past five months, Ibrahem has had a blacksmith workshop. He has built a good reputation among customers because of his high quality work. Ibrahem's project is still new and considered a small workshop. It is a profitable project but also needs more support at the beginning to cover some necessary costs.

Ibrahem is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing an iron-cutting machine and quantities of iron for the workshop he is operating. Taking this loan will offer to Ibrahem the necessary tools and suitable quantities of iron to continue his work and provide his customers high quality. This will satisfy his customers and improve his income positively.

Ibrahem is photographed while he is working in his workshop.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase an iron-cutting machine and quantities of iron

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también es quien le ayuda en el negocio. Don Santos era empleado de una empresa de venta de helados y luego el decidió comenzar con su propio negocio, inicio vendiendo solamente con un frízer pequeño y una bicicleta, en la actualidad don Santos cuenta con un frízer mas grande y tres bicicletas para distribuir helados para lograr una mayor zona de venta, tiene dos empleados y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am y culmina a las 6:00 pm. El préstamo que solicita don Santos lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de producto para producir el helado y una bicicleta para que le ayude a cubrir todo su mercado. Con este préstamo cambiaria la vida de don Santos ya que no contaba con el dinero suficiente para comprar la mercadería necesaria para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El único problema que enfrenta es en la temporada de lluvia ya que las ventas bajan. Una de sus metas es establecer una distribuidora de helados más amplio y con mucha mayor productividad. Es su primer crédito en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Santos, 30, is married and has two children.  His wife does household chores and also helps him with the business.  Santos used to be employed by an ice-cream selling firm and he then decided to start his own business.  He started out selling with just a small freezer and a bicycle.  Currently, Santos has a bigger freezer and three bicycles to distribute ice-cream and covers a larger sales area.  He has two employees and his work day starts at 7am and ends at 6pm.  

The loan Santos is asking for is needed to buy ingredients to make ice-cream and to buy a bicycle to help him cover his entire market.  This loan will change Santos’ life because he’s not had enough money to buy the necessary merchandise to meet customer demand.  The only problem he faces is the rainy season when sales drop.   One of his goals is to open a larger ice-cream distributing center with much more productivity.  This is his first FAMA loan and he intends to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle and ingredients to make ice-cream.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
Mercy, de 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su conviviente Wilson de 25 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Jean de 09 y Katsumi de 03 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mercy, consiste en la venta de comida, es una muy buena cocinera además de ser muy amable y cordial, es por eso que el puesto de comida es el más concurrido del mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos platillos que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña aprendió a cocinar observando a su madre y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo, cuando empezó a trabajar con este negocio lo hizo vendiendo solo unos cuantos platos, pero con el tiempo fue creciendo y ahora ofrece una gran variedad de platos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender sola a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, tiene como planes a futuro el de mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de comida y así tener más clientes. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP,  esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y no dejar mal al grupo tan bueno que le esta dando la oportunidad de poder incrementar su capital de trabajo respaldándola en su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes y algunos utensilios que le hace falta renovar, entre las cosas que necesita como platos, cubiertos y otros.
texts.en:
Mercy, 25, is a young mother of a friendly and hardworking family. She lives with her parents and her partner Wilson, 25, and their two beloved children Jean 9, and Katsumi 3, whom they want to provide a better quality of life. Mercy’s work consists of selling food. She is a very good cook as well as being very friendly and cordial, that is why the food stall is the busiest in the Bellavista market in the city of Pucallpa. Every day her customers gather at this place to taste the delicious dishes she prepares. She is a very skillful cook. She learned when she was very young watching her mother and now she is happy doing this work. When she started working in this business she sold a few dishes, but with time it increased and now she offers a variety of dishes.

What she likes most about her job is cooking and that is why she does it with great care. She has been doing this for six years and found that the hardest part is attending to everyone who enters the restaurant on her own. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of the food stall so she can have more customers. 

This will be her first loan with MFP institution. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as she will feel more confident in moving forward with her work. On the other hand, she is committed to fulfill her monthly payments and not leave the group in a bad position who is giving her this opportunity to increase her working capital, backing her in the communal bank.

With the amount requested, 1000 Peruvian Soles, she will buy ingredients and utensils, that she needs to replace, among other items she needs such as plates, cutlery etc…

loans.use: to buy plates, cutlery and other items.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She tells us that it has been doing well, and she does not regret starting it, since it is a profitable project. Hope is happy to see her that her profit has increased since the previous loan. Her goal is to become a supplier of layers and broilers in the region. With this new loan, she will be able to buy chicks, chicken feed and medicines.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed and medicines for her poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime de 43 años de edad es un vendedor ambulante que se dedica a la venta de frutas naturales como fresas, kiwi, manzana, uvas, Este negocio inició después de tener  una tienda donde vendía ranchos, víveres, en pequeñas cantidades, pero no llenaba sus expectativas de   rentabilidad. Poco a poco ahorró y alquiló una carretilla, compró  frutas y empezó a venderlas  por todas las calles aledañas a su barrio y también agregó el famoso “tutufruti” , es decir salpicón de frutas preparado con cola y frutas picadas y endulzadas con miel, al cual le adicionan hielo y lo convierte en un refresco delicioso para apaciguar el inmenso calor producido por el cálido sol y clima del caribe.   Hoy sale con su carretilla propia en la que carga frutas y visita todas las calles del barrio y de otros aledaños a su vivienda, constituyendo una clientela de 150 compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para continuar creciendo en su negocio. Pues con el anterior aumentó su capital de trabajo y con su credikiva al que aplica hoy, espera responder a la temporada de navidad y de año nuevo con frutas apropiadas a la temporada como las uvas que son parte del brindis de todas las familias y que por tradición cada miembro consume 12 de ellas al finalizar la noche del 31 de Diciembre y pide así mismo sus 12 deseos de prosperidad y esto es lo que justamente hace efectivo su credikiva.
texts.en:
Jaime, 43, is a street vendor who makes a living selling natural fruits such as strawberries, kiwi, apples, and grapes.  He started this business after having a store where he sold meals and provisions in small quantities, but it didn't live up to his expectations of profitability.

Little by little he saved and rented a little cart.  He bought fruit and began to sell it throughout the streets near his neighborhood.  He also added the famous tutti frutti, a fruit salad prepared with soda and chopped fruit sweetened with honey and served on ice, becoming a delicious drink that pacifies the immense heat of the warm Caribbean sun and climate.

These days he goes out with his own fruit cart and visits all the streets of the neighborhood and other places near his home.  He has a  customer base of 150 buyers.

Currently he's applying for a Kiva loan, his second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to continue growing in his business.  With the previous loan he increased his working capital.  With the Kiva loan he's applying for now, he hopes to respond to the Christmas and New Year season with seasonal fruits such as grapes, which are part of the toast of every family.

The tradition is for all the members of the family to eat 12 grapes at the end of the night on December 31 and request for themselves 12 desires for prosperity.  This is precisely what makes his Kiva loan effective.

loans.use: to buy grapes

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is requesting a new loan to buy a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock his store. 

His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. 

He also hopes that, through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock his store.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and son in a small village in Telavi district, East Georgia. His wife is a teacher at the local school. Zakaria is involved in agricultural activities. 

In particular, Zakaria has 265 sheep. He sells lambs seasonally at a good price. He is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing sheep. 

After purchasing additional sheep, he will be able to expand his business. This will cause an increase in the family income. With increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Panakh

texts.en: Panakh is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and parents in the small village of Marneuli district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and 2 calves. Panakh owns 0.8 hectares of agricultural land, where potatoes and eggplants are grown. In addition, they have a greenhouse, where tomatoes are grown. Panakh sells harvested products locally at a good price. He is a very hard-working man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. Panakh requested a loan to purchase calves and wood for the greenhouse. After Panakh buys the wood, the greenhouse will be heated properly, and he will ensure a good harvest. Since he will buy additional calves, he will expand the number of cattle and increase his family's income. With increased income, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions. Panakh awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves and wood for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en:
Xuyen is 28 years old and married. She lives with her two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Xuyen has run a general store at her house for four years. She sells milk, many kinds of snacks, and beverages. She intends to use her loan to buy products to sell, such as candies and beverages.

She hopes that her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell such as candies and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for renovating the greenhouse and covering cultivation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Tong, 43, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including two children. Tong and his wife earn money from their business processing metals. He would like to get a loan to buy a metal processing machine that will help him better process and manufacture metals to meet the needs of his customers. He hopes his business expands through the loan. He hopes that his family's income increases, and that they will have access to a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a machine for processing metal.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old married man who has been working at selling chicken for the past 12 years. Ali was only 9 years old when he started working to help his parents in making their living. His childhood was not impressive, and that is why he opened his own chicken-selling shop in 2008.

Ali is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy the necessary machines requested for his business, including a new, large refrigerator and a new, special chicken-cutting machine, and to perform necessary maintenance on the existing machines and to paint the shop's walls.

Ali is very excited about this loan, since this is the first time he has applied for such a service, and he is willing to invest in a well-managed way.

He hopes to continue expanding his business as much as he can to provide his family with the best living ever, unlike his own.

loans.use: to buy new machines requested for his business.

loans.name: Mouwafak

texts.en:
Mouwafak is a 34-year-old married man, father of two children for whom he sacrifices his whole life to provide them with a good living. Mouwafak has been selling toys for 20 years. He was 14 years old when he started working to cover his expenses since his family's financial situation required an extra income to support themselves.

In 2005, Mouwafak opened his own gifts and gadgets shop to improve his income and develop a better living. He loves his business since it puts a smile on children's faces. Mouwafak applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital for special Christmas and New Year gifts and gadgets. This will be his third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with good standing in repayment history. Mouwafak assures lenders that his previous loans made a positive impact on both his social and financial situations.

He hopes to keep improving his business to continue pleasing and responding to almost all of his customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To increase his business capital with special Christmas and New Year gifts and gadgets.

loans.name: Sammita

texts.en: Sammita is a 31-year-old who lives in Pipradhi-6 toll in Balirampur VDC of the Bara District. She lives with her husband and two sons. After getting married Sammita and her husband started a construction business to build shutters for buildings. They stared with a loan of just Rs. 20,000 from Nirdhan Bank as a loan which was used for purchasing wood (pataha) for shuttering buildings. Sammita now wants to expand the business so she has taken a loan of Rs 100,000.

loans.use: to pay for wood which is used for building shutters.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for cultivating maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Alvina

texts.en:
Alvina lives in the Ararat region with her husband, son, daughter and mother-in-law. Alvina runs a little store where she trades in different goods. Due to her friendly attitude and high-quality service, Alvina has gained many loyal clients over the years. Now Alvina needs some financial investment to increase the variety of products she sells, in order to meet her clients' demands. With the loan Alvina will purchase supplies for her shop.

As the shop is the only source of income for this family, it is very important for Alvina to have a high income and ensure a better living for her family.

loans.use: to pay for stock for her shop.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is taking out another loan to expand her existing business. Her aim is to see it grow and flourish. She is grateful for the previous loan that had a positive impact on both her business and her standard of living. Mwanamisi plans to use this loan to stock tomatoes, kale, cabbages, potatoes, oranges, etc.

loans.use: to stock tomatoes, kale, cabbages, potatoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman, and she has 1 child. She describes herself as a trustworthy woman. She operates a general store where she sells shoes and clothes. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents and the general public from the town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of shoes and clothes. She will use the loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (Kes) to buy clothes and shoes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's standard of living. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM; she managed to successfully repay a previous loan of Kes 50,000.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Los Lirios” conformado por 06 mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio y pasan al ciclo 25. Eva tiene 42 años, conviviente con 06 hijos de la cual 04 de ellos en etapa escolar. Eva se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, hamburguesas, tripita de pollo que lo prepara en una parrilla a carbón en su casa y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Eva solicito el préstamo para la compra de carbón, servilletas y platos descartables. Su sueño es tener un local más grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Eva está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas Kiva. Eva es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo rojo y buzo plomo.
texts.en:
This is the “Los Lirios” group and is made up of 6 enterprising ladies who have different businesses.  The group is in its 25th cycle. Eva is 42 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are in the school stage.  She sells anticuchos, hamburgers, and chicken gizzards which she prepares on a charcoal grill in her home.  She has steady cutomers.

Eva is asking for this loan in order to buy charcoal, napkins, and disposable plates.  Her dream is to have a larger point of sale where she can better serve her customers.  Eva is very happy about this loan and is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Eva is the farthest to the right in the picture and is wearing a red top and grey pants.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 36 years old and lives in the Terjola district with her husband, two children, and mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. Maya’s husband has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. The family has a vineyard and a plot of land where nuts are grown. They complete all of the necessary agricultural work to ensure a good-quality harvest. The harvested products are sold locally. In addition to her agricultural work, Maya works at the cannery and gets a small monthly salary.

With the requested loan, Maya will install a natural gas line in her house. Another part of the loan will be used to purchase a gas cooker. After installing the gas line, the family will be able to improve their living conditions and satisfy their daily needs. Maya is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to install a natural gas line and purchase a gas cooker.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy new products such as snack food, confectionery and household items to stock her general store.  Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and her sales, and in continuing to attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new products to stock her general store

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting another loan to purchase more stock for her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Xuan Tuan

texts.en: Tuan would like another loan to buy fresh water cans and ice pieces for selling. His previous loan enabled him to earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will attract new customers and through the loan he hopes that he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fresh water cans and ice pieces or selling

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is 53 years old. She lives with her family, composed of her husband and six grown children. She is a very resourceful woman who has never allowed life's adversities to have the best of her. She is very responsible both with her household chores and in her daily life. With efforts and determination she runs a small business selling fish in the central market of her community. She gets up every morning with renewed confidence, working to grant the best to her family. 

Tima wishes to increase her sales with the approaching of a very good season, but she does not have enough money to invest in her project, and for this reason she has come to Yehu to ask for a loan that she will use to buy more fish. She hopes to be blessed and to succeed in achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Lua

texts.en: Lua is 42 years old, and is married. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. Lua has been running a food stall in front of her door for 1 year. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her two children. She and her husband earn a living working as a wholesaler & retailer of pork pies. Lua is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new food products to sell so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan her family can have more money to set aside for facing life's difficulties in the future and to give her children a good quality of education.

loans.use: To buy new food products for selling

loans.name: Gazmend

texts.en:
Gazmend is a hard-working Romani man who has gained respect from all who have known him. He is a 36-year-old father of a 4-year-old son. They are both photographed here. He is a loving husband, father, and son to his parents according to his wife and others. 

He lived and worked in Greece for years until recently, when he came back to live in his homeland, a major city in central Albania. While in Greece, he learned construction trades and has since been practicing the same profession. Because of the reputation he has gained as a trustworthy, reliable, and kind man, he’s always been working.
 
Gazmend now needs a loan to repair the leaky ceiling in his home.

loans.use: to repair the leaky ceiling of his tiny one-room family home

loans.name: Krong Group

texts.en:
The Krong group is made up of four partners who live in the Teshie community. They are Daniel, Abam, Rebecca, and Mary. 

They chose to be traders because they could not pursue their high education, and they have not regretted to have chosen trading as a profession. They sell cement, beans, fresh/smoked fish, and shirts. 

Daniel 34 years old and is a single parent of two children. The children are all in school. He sells cement in the market where customers from in and around his environs come to buy products. This is his fourth loan cycle and needs an amount of GHS 1,200 to be able to buy more cement to meet current demands.

Daniel and his colleagues need a total amount of GHS 3,350 to buy more goods to sell to their customers.

loans.use: to buy more and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en: Yunus is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography, and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. This year he has entered the Technology University. His parents are workers. His mother is a dressmaker, and his father is a builder. Their income is too small to pay for Yunus’s study at the university. Yunus wants to be one of the best technologists in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. He is asking for a loan to pay for his studies at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is a very hardworking, visionary man with the urge to move ahead in life. He has been running a retail shop in his home for several years. Thanks to this, he has been able to provide for his family. Since it is the only source of income for the family, Ismail makes sure that he finds every opportunity to increase sales. He is grateful for the support given, and he promises to repay this loan as scheduled so that he can ask for a new loan. With this loan, he plans to buy merchandise such as bales of flour, sacks of basic grains, cleaning products, etc.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, sacks of basic grains, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Rezqy Jaya Group

texts.en:
Roswiyati is the group leader of five people called “Rezqy Jaya”. They all live at Kebon Pala village in the east of Jakarta. 

Roswiyati is a mother (48 years old) of three children; two of whom are in college.  Rosiwati’s husband is work in as private employees. Her mother-in-law still lives with her family.

Roswiyati runs a business from her house, selling cookies and cooked food. She started her business seven years ago.  Her daily income can be  150,000 IDR . With this business, Roswiyati can supply her family needs and pay school fees for her children.

Roswiyati and the other members of the "Rezqy Jaya" group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the second time so they can increase their working capital.  Roswiyati will use it to buy cookies she can sell during the Christmas season, and at the end of the year to welcome  the new year.  

She has a plan to send her children to school until they receive their bachelor's degrees, and get good spiritual knowledge.

loans.use: to buy some kind of cookies for sale in the Christmas and New Year's holidays.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 44-year-old lady married to James. They are blessed with three children. She does dairy farming in the outskirts of Kangemi. Alice gets a monthly income of 50,000 shillings and has been in this business for 17 years now.

This will be Alice's seventh loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow and laying chicks to raise and sell. 

In future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy a cow and laying chicks

loans.name: Shreekhetra Self Help Group

texts.en: Namita is a 34-year-old lady. She lives with her husband and two children. Namita runs her terracotta business with the help of her husband. She learned this work from her family. She makes earthen pots and statues of gods and paints them. She supplies those finished products to the dealers in the market. She plans to expand her business, appoint new work staff to help her, and to own a shop in the marketplace for direct sale of the product to customers. She needs a loan to buy more resources like paints, brushes, clay and ornaments for statues of Indian God and Goddess and to set up her own shop in the market. She wants to give her children a better education and let her family live a happy life. Namita is requesting the loan in a group of nine members. All the members are women and all of them live in the same community. They named their group Shreekhetra Self Help Group and they are situated in the Khurda district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase paints, brushes, clay and ornaments for her terracotta work.

loans.name: Ololkukua

texts.en:
Ololkukua is 46 years old and married to Nyambura, a business lady. He supports a family of six and his children are between 1 and 22 years old. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last seven years with a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He is taking his fourth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Zaal

texts.en:
Zaal comes from the village of Persati in the western part of the country. He is a 41-year-old farmer and lives with his wife and infant daughter.  Zaal is heading up the family agricultural business. He grows maize and grapes on 0.6 hectare of land owned by the family. Vegetables are sold to retailers locally and grapes are used for winemaking. Wine is sold locally to the villagers. Besides his agricultural works, Zaal works as an operator at the local petrol station.

With the requested credit, Zaal plans to expand the vineyard by planting additional grape vines. He will be able to produce more wine and vodka and sell it in the local market, as there is quite a big demand for his wine in the village. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business and another part will be saved for house renovation in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase young grape vines and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mahmoud appears in her Kiva profile photo next to his taxi.

Sabreen is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother to seven sons. Sabreen is a housewife and her husband is a taxi driver.

For the past four years, Sabreen's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but from time to time, he needs more support to cover necessary costs.

Sabreen is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives and make some repairs to it such as installing new mirrors and lights. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Sabreen's husband to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To repair the taxi and purchase a new engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby clothes, shoes and diapers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en: Bendera is a 33-year-old married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be a social woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to run a new business of a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan from SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of KES 30,000, which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and is the father of four children, one of whom is employed. Ali owns a shop and sells agricultural pesticides. He established his business in 2005 and now he has an employee. He had built good experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. He is requesting a sum of $2,400 to rent the next-door shop in order to expand his business. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions to his family.

loans.use: to rent the next-door shop in order to expand his retail business.

loans.name: Abdulelah

texts.en:
Abdulelah is a 26-year-old married man and has one child. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He earns a low daily income, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. He owns a small house that has old windows and doors. He intends to buy new windows and doors.

He is requesting for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing new windows and doors in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy new windows and doors for his house.

loans.name: Abilfat

texts.en: Abilfat is an honest, purposeful, and hard-working tradesman. He is 52-years-old, married, and has two children. He has opened a small grocery store. He has been selling groceries for 18 years. Abilfat wants the loan to buy groceries with a goal to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy groceries with a goal to increase sales.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 44-year-old married man, and the father of four children. For 25 years, he has been working in selling home use gas bottles that are requested for ovens, stoves and heaters during winter season. In 1999, Ibrahim started his own mobile gas bottles selling business, where he gets full bottles from the main gas company, and he drives his van all over the region to sell his filled bottles and exchange them with the customers' empty ones. Such a service is highly requested by most people, since they prefer not to go and wait to fill their own bottles. Ibrahim is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his son's engagement expenses. This will be his sixth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, his previous loans helped him a lot in improving and developing his business and lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for his son's engagement expenses.

loans.name: Abada Group

texts.en:
The Abada group is made up of four women who live in the Teshie community. They have been together for a year now. They sell cooking utensils, fresh and smoked fish and tilapia, respectively.

Christiana is 60 years old and a widow. Though her children are supportive, she still wants to sell to keep herself fit and active. She sells fish in the market and also supplies to restaurants in and around her community.  

This is her fourth loan, and she needs an amount of 700 GHC (Ghana cedis) to be able to buy more fish to meet the demand.

Christiana, Angela, Beatrice and Mary need a total amount of 1,750 GHC to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy fish and sell to customers.

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en: Mchekwisha is an enterprising woman who has shown great entrepreneurial skills. She has a water distribution business, as well as a retail shop in her home. She wants to increase her inventory in her shop to enable her to provide a variety of commodities to her customers. Mchekwisha says, that since she started getting loans, her income has increased and that her living standards has greatly improved. She will use the loan to buy food stuffs and basic medicines, and also repair some broken pipes.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs and basic medicines, and to repair broken water pipes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Katwekolere Group

texts.en: Aminah is a divorced woman aged 46 years. She has six children of which two go to school and four dropped out of school due to lack of tuition. Aminah sells green vegetables that she supplies to a popular African food specialist restaurant around the city. She also sells some to her neighbors and passers-by; she earns income to look after her family. Her biggest challenge is the weather changes especially during the hot season when there is short supply and increase in prices result into little vegetable sells which affects her profits so much. Her main vision is to see her children successful and prosper in life. Regina another divorced woman with five children wants to construct a water tank that will harvest water for sell. It is her sole source of income for the livelihood of her family. She is hard working and has determination to survive with her family in a hard economic environment.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell and to build a water tank.

loans.name: Eliu

texts.es:
Eliu, de 52 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente Nancy de 45 años y su querida hija menor Lila de 18 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro, además de su hija el tiene dos hijos mayores quienes ya son independientes y a quienes educo como un padre ejemplar y trabajando para brindarles lo mejor. El trabajo que tiene Eliu consiste en brindar que las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa estén más seguras, su labor como Vigilante ha hecho que sea una persona muy querida por los vecinos, ya que conocen los peligros a los que está expuesto por las noches y el valor que tiene para afrontarlas. Aunque le va muy bien en este trabajo, el sueldo que percibe no le alcanza para brindarle a su familia una vida digna, es por eso que hace algunos meses decidido poner una tienda de abarrotes, la cual administra su esposa y con el cual pudo mejorar en parte sus ingresos, desde que inicio su negocio tuvo muchas dificultades como el de no saber muy como es el manejo del mismo pero con el tiempo y las experiencias esta mejorando cada día mas.
Se siente muy feliz en su trabajo, ya que le es muy gratificante saber que gracias a su labor, las personas pueden dormir tranquilas, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer toda la noche muy al tanto de las cosas que suceden en esta ciudad. Por tanto éste será el crédito número 08 con MFP, esta muy contento por que le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, esta contento de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios y puntuales en sus pagos.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará productos para su tienda de abarrotes ya que aumentara el tipo de productos a ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eliu is 52 years old and a hardworking and friendly man.  He lives in a home of his own with his wife, 45 year old Nancy, and his lovely 18 year old daughter, to whom he wants to provide a brighter future.  Besides his daughter, he also has two adult sons already on their own, whom he taught like a good father, and he worked to provide the best for them.  Eliu’s work consists of making sure that the streets of the city of Pucallpa are safer.  Being a watchman has made him well liked by his neighbors, because they know the dangers to which he is exposed at night, and the courage he has for facing them.  Although things are going well for him in this job, his salary is not enough to provide his family with a dignified life, so a few months ago he started a grocery store, which his wife manages and with which he was able to increase his income in part.  Since he began his business, he has had many difficulties, such as not knowing how to manage it, but over time he gained experience and has been improving each day.  

He is happy in his job, since it’s very satisfying to know that thanks to his job, people can sleep soundly.  He has been doing this for four years and he considers the most difficult thing is having to stay up all night, given the things that happen in the city.  This will be his 8th loan through MFP and he is very happy for the financial support that will allow him to increase his working capital.  He knows that he needs to be very responsible and above all on time with his payments.  He is glad to be part of his communal bank because the members are united and on time with their payments.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Las Pilitas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal las Pilitas está conformado por 8 integrantes, siete mujeres, y un hombre. Con familias y con 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos integrantes del banco son personas trabajadoras, responsables, de buenas costumbres. Estos integrantes son  originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Migdalia es la coordinadora del banco comunal las pilitas la cual se encarga de las responsabilidad del cumplimientos de las cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajadas de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. La rutina diaria de Migdalia es levantarse a las 5: am para preparar su pana de cuajada y salir a vender de forma ambulante en su comunidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo de comprar más leche y cuajada para preparar la cuajada.  El banco comunal las Pilitas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Las Pilitas” communal bank is made up of eight members; seven women and one man all with families and a total of 10 children to care for.  These members are hardworking, responsible people with good customs.  These members are all from Sauce, which is located in the northern zone of the country.

Migdalia is the bank’s coordinator and is in charge of making payments for the group.  She sells curds on foot and from her home.  Her daily routine is to arise at 5:00 am to prepare her curds and go out to sell in the community.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more milk and curd.  The “Las Pilitas” communal bank is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people of low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be a social woman. She operates a food stall where she sells fish commonly known as Omena in the local language. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a busy market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Jumwa will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) loan to buy fish to sell. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked food stall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of 30,000 Kes, which she managed to repay succesfully.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for mobile phobe accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for his business.

loans.name: Madosho

texts.en: Madosho is a very responsible man who values his family's well-being very much. He does not want his family members to lack basic needs. Madosho is still operating his retail shop, which is giving him commendable results. He wants to take advantage of the forthcoming festive season where sales normally increase. For this reason, he is asking for another loan to purchase bales of flour, sacks of rice and beans, and instant products. Since the last loan, his business has been gradually growing.

loans.use: to purchase bales of flour, sacks of rice and beans, and instant products.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 38 years old.  She is the mother of three children and she resides with her husband in Paynesville South.  Her children are between the ages of 15 and 22 and they all live at home and attend school.  Her husband is a driver and he uses his vehicle to transport her goods to her business area where she sells from 8 AM to 4 PM.  She learned to sell from her aunty and started this business with a little money that she saved from a saving club. 

For the past seven years she has been selling raw fish in the market.  She makes a profit when she sells because she always sells cassava fish, bonnie fish and snapper.  She is grateful to the lenders for their support of her business.  With this loan, she will purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business.  Her plans for the future are to buy land and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of raw fish for the business.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim has been in this barber shop business for a year. He is 20 years old. He is a single person. Rasim lives in the Absheron region with his parents, but he is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) person from Fizuli town. Rasim needs to increase his monthly income to help his parents. Now he needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to improve his new barber shop business and to buy some new apparatus for his barber shop.

loans.use: to buy some new apparatus for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Bahman

texts.en: Bahman is 38 years old. He was married and has three beautiful children. Bahman lives in Absheron region with his family, but is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town. Bahman has been in this cafe business for three years. Now he needs 2,000 (Azerbaijani New Manat) to repair his cafe for improving his business. He has a cafe where he makes a delicious Azerbaijan national course "Kebab".

loans.use: to repair his cafe.

loans.name: Duc

texts.en: Duc, 53, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Duc started an internet store four years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying computers to better serve his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy computers to serve his customers

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 41 years old and lives in Sevan city with her husband, two daughters, and a son. Her husband works as a court clerk. Anna graduated from Yerevan State University, in the field of geography. Since 1993 she has been working in Sevan secondary school as a teacher. She teaches geography, natural sciences, and social science.  Anna’s family is also engaged in agricultural activities. They have cows and calves. Her son and younger daughter now study in secondary school. Her elder daughter is a student at the State Armenian University of Economics in the Management Department. 
Anna is asking Kiva lenders for a 225,000 AMD loan to pay her younger daughter's tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay her younger daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
The desire to get ahead is one of the dreams of Asha, who has been running a business selling coconuts. She is grateful since she started this business, it has given her good results. 

Asha wants to make new investments, but the main challenge she is facing is the lack of enough capital to do such investment. She is a determined woman who does not want to see her children lack any basic need. 

Asha seeks a loan to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business. She has a good repayment history and she is a responsible woman who is sure to repay her debt, as scheduled, since she believes in faithfulness.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en: Nune is involved in agriculture. She keeps 10 colonies of beehives and four cows. She has applied for this loan to expand her farm with a special milk cow and a calf. This will enable her to get milk and use it in cheese production, which she will sell in local markets. Nune lives with her husband and two children. Nune's husband is a taxi driver, but his income is not enough to cover family's basic costs. With the help of the loan, Nune wants to gather and sell more cheese. This will help her to sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for a special milk cow and a calf

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a man of thirty three years, married to Mary, and a father of two children. He works in dairy farming, chicken rearing, and vegetable farming. He has been in these businesses for five years now and gets a monthly income of 70,000 KES.

This will be Amos's second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use it to buy a dairy cow. In the future, he wants to diversify his business and do green house farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Qrisitine

texts.en:
Qrisitine lives in Kapan town with her husband and two-year-old daughter. Together with her husband she keeps seven colonies of beehives. She makes ecologically clean honey and sells it in the local markets.

In order to increase her income, Qristine would like expand her agricultural business. She has applied for this loan to purchase two mother pigs and 10 little pigs. This will enable her to increase her monthly income and she will be able to ensure a better future for her little daughter. The loan is very important for Qristine and her young family to have a stable income and to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two mother pigs and 10 little pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Faig

texts.en: Faig is 36 years old. He is married and has three children. Faig is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Shusha town. Now, he lives in the Absheron region with his family. Faig needs a loan of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy spare parts for his car. He has been in the taxi business for three years. He must increase his monthly income to support his big family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two children. Her husband is a worker at a plastic company. Mai lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For 12 years she has operated a food stall to sell meals to people in her community.

Mai would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Mai also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family faces.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Seleto

texts.en:
Seleto is a single lady, aged 29 years old. She takes care of her three school-going siblings. Seleto operates a tailoring shop in Ntulele and has been running the business for five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Seleto has borrowed a second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase additional fabrics for dress making in this festive season.

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going siblings. Seleto's dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for dressmaking

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 61-year-old married man, and father of eight children. He has worked in his agriculture business for 40 years. He is well-known in the region for his good reputation and special production.

Husein is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for leasing the agricultural land he has worked for 40 years. He also works  planting and selling apples, and owns a school bus which he drives during the winter season to keep a good income during the agriculture low season. This is to cover his family's expenses.

This is Husein's first experience as Al Majmoua borrower, with great expectations concerning the results to be obtained.

He hopes to stay in good health and shape to keep on doing the requested work.

loans.use: to pay to lease agricultural land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gilbert fait l’agriculture des maïs. Marié, âgé de 37 ans, Gilbert a 7 enfants dont le plus grand a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 6 mois. Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge.
Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’école secondaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2010 et le cycle actuel lui est le premier.
Ce crédit va lui permettre d’acheter les engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre.
Il n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Monsieur Gilbert va utiliser la stratégie d’utiliser les engrais chimiques pour pouvoir accroitre son activité. Il va aussi acquérir des nouveaux champs.
Pour son business, il a l’ambition d’être le grand fournisseur des maïs dans sa région.
Pour sa famille, il va faire son mieux pour assurer le bien être de sa famille et paiera les frais scolaires et académiques de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Gilbert is a corn farmer. Married and 37 years old, he has seven children - the eldest is 14 and the youngest 6 months old. Four of the children attend school and he has no other dependents. He was born in Rwanda, and completed six years of secondary education.
He began to work with ACB Ltd in 2010 and this current loan cycle is his first. This loan will allow him to purchase chemical fertilisers and to pay for labour. He does not anticipate any problem with repaying this loan.
Gilbert will adopt the strategy of applying chemical fertilisers to be able to grow his activity. He is also going to acquire new fields. As regards his business, his ambition is to be the principal corn supplier in his area. For his family, he will do his utmost to ensure their wellbeing, and will pay the school and academic costs for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilisers and to pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Akhmed

texts.en:
Akhmed is 60 years old. He lives with his wife in a small village in Marneuli district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and a hectare of agricultural land where they grow maize. Akhmed sells harvested maize with vine in the open market locally at a good price. In addition, Akhmed has a greenhouse where he grows tomatoes. He sells harvested tomatoes locally. 

Akhmed is a very hard-working man and does all the necessary work to ensure a good harvest. He requested a loan for purchasing tomato seeds and wood for fuel to heat his greenhouse. After purchasing wood, the greenhouse will be heated properly and he will buy seeds and sow tomatoes. This will increase his family's income. With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. Akhmed awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds and wood for fuel to heat his greenhouse.

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
Victory group is made up of four women who live in the Teshie community. They have been together for a year now. 

They sell fresh/smoked fish, second-hand cloths, provisions, tea and bread respectively.

Rafia from 'Nogbo baafe' has joined this group because this group is close to her current place of residence.

Victoria is 46 years old. She is married to Kwabena, who is a 47 year old spare parts dealer. They have three children who are all in school. She still wants to sell fish to keep herself fit and active and to support her husband. 

She sells fish in the market and also supplies to restaurants in and around her community. This is her fourth loan and she needs an amount of GHS 350 to be able buy more fish to meet the demand.

Victoria, Hellina, Gloria and Rafia need a total amount of GHS 1,650 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy fish and sell it to her customers.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 41 years old. She lives in a small village of Sagarejo District with her family: her husband and three sons. Her sons go to the local school. Marine’s husband works as a worker at the local poultry farm and gets a monthly income. Marine runs the family’s small dairy farm. She sells milk and yogurt in her village. She works hard and has rich experience in her work. 

Marine requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle. She will purchase hay; which will be used for feeding the cows and calves during the winter season. Since the cows and calves will be fed properly in the winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family. This will help Marine to increase her dairy farm and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man of thirty four years old, married to Rahab and a father of one child. He repairs mobile phones and also sells mobile phone accessories. He has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Paul's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy mobile phone accessories like chargers, etc. He wants to open a bigger shop in future.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Truphosa

texts.en:
Truphosa, is 34 years old, married to Patrick, and the mother of three children. She sells second-hand clothes in Uthiru and has been in this business for one and half years. She gets a monthly income of thirty two thousand KES.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a bail of second-hand clothes. In future, she wants to open another boutique.

loans.use: to purchase a bail of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kholida

texts.ru: Мотивированная и умелая женщина более 5 лет развивает бизнес в сфере шитья женских одежд. Ее зовут Холида. Ей  30 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет  3 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить семью. Холида должна справляться своими расходами сама, а также она обеспечивает детей одеждой и образованием. Для развития бизнеса и получения больше дохода, Холида упорно работает. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Однако ее конкурентки имеют вышивальную машинку, и многие клиенты предпочитают услугу портних, которые делают вышивки на их платьях. Если Холида тоже не будет покупать вышивальную машинку и не предоставить такую услугу, то она потеряет всех клиентов. Она нуждается вышивальной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3500 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This motivated and capable woman has been developing her business of sewing women's clothing for over five years.  Her name is Kholida.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  Her husband earns a small salary and he isn't in a position to fully provide for the family.  Kholida must meet her own expenses, as well as provide clothing and schooling for the children.  

In order to develop her business and earn a larger income, Kholida works very hard.  Because of her good service, she has a large client base.  However, many of her competitors have embroidery machines and many people prefer seamstresses who are able to embroider.  If Kholida doesn't also buy an embroidery machine and offer this service, she will lose all her clients.  She needs an embroidery machine, but her income isn't enough for her to buy one.  She is requesting a loan of 3,500 somoni (TJS) to buy an embroidery machine.  She is relying on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: В канун Нового года Асрор хочет развивать свой бизнес. Асрор очень энергичный человек и каждое мгновение он берет для себя новое вдохновение. Ему 35 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети еще не трудоспособные, то есть они учатся в средней школе. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 17  лет он занимается скотоводством и виноградарством.  Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. В ведении бизнеса ему помогает его жена. Асрор хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму    1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он является повторным клиентом и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он обещает погасить займ во время. От полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
During the countdown to the New Year, Asror yearns to develop his business. He is a very energetic person, and each moment brings him a new source of inspiration. Asror is 35 years old, married, and raising 3 young children who attend secondary school. The climate of Asror's home is very favourable to cultivating crops and animal husbandry, and so he has been raising cattle and growing grapes for over 17 years. Asror sells the cattle after taking care of it for several months, and has many customers at the local market. His wife helps him with the business.

Asror would like to develop his business but lacks the funds to do so. He is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni to purchase cattle and thereby expand his enterprise. Asror is a returning client of IMON International, has a good credit history, and promises to repay the loan on time. He plans to use his additional profits to provide his children with good education and access to modern technologies. Asror is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to develop his business

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru:
Муродчон пришел в МДО "Арванд" для получения кредита.   Он женат, имеет 3 детей.  Он раньше ездил в Российскую Федерацию и зарабатывал там, но по каким то обстоятельствам он не смог дальше там работать. Но дома  его семья когда он отсутствовал содержали скот и с весны по осень выращивали различные сельскохозяйственные  продукты.
